Title: Data Analyst III
Desc:
Sinai Health is a leading academic health science centre with a provincial, national and international reputation for discovering and delivering life-changing care. Since 2015, we have provided excellent and compassionate care in hospital, community and home. Comprised of Mount Sinai Hospital, Hennick Bridgepoint Hospital, the Lunenfeld-Tanenbaum Research Institute and our system partner Circle of Care, we translate scientific breakthroughs, push boundaries for health solutions, and educates future clinical and scientific leaders.
Sinai Health is fully committed to a culture of belonging and an inclusive environment that attracts and retains a diverse workforce, at all levels of the organization, that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome applications from racialized persons, women, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, 2SLGBTQ+ persons, and those from diverse backgrounds and experiences. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know through the Accommodation Phone Line at 416-586-4800, ext. 7050, or email HiringProcessAccommodation.msh@sinaihealth.ca .
At Sinai Health, we care, create possibilities and offer hope. We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst III for the Information Services department
The Data Analyst III is a senior analyst position within the Systems and Databases team. Reporting to the Manager, Systems and Databases, this position works collaboratively and cohesively in a dynamic, fast-paced, multidisciplinary environment with a diverse group of professionals from Information Services, Clinical Operations and Support Services.
The Data Analyst’s will design data modeling/analysis services used to mine enterprise systems and applications to support and enhance business processes. This individual is also responsible for building, deploying, and maintaining data support tools, metadata inventories, and definitions for database file/table creation.
The successful incumbent will coach and mentor junior analysts to further enhance and develop their existing knowledge base, skill sets and competencies in providing excellence and effectiveness.
Duties and Responsibilities:
Identify, evaluate and analyze, design, develop and implement required data queries in response to business user needs. Responsible for all aspects, including change management, of all data pipelines, data reporting and distribution, scheduled/on-domain jobs, data reporting applications/portals as well as their maintenance and support.
Create data definitions for new database file/table development and/or changes to existing ones.
Determine required network components to ensure data access, as well as data consistency and integrity. Collaborate with database and disaster recovery administrators to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets.
Develop data models and protocols for mining production databases in conjunction with data owners and department managers.
Work cooperatively with project teams, clinical and business teams and units, research teams and end users across the organization to determine data and reporting requirements for new and existing systems and data sources; design and implement solutions to meet these requirements.
Assist in the development of data management policies and procedures.
Develop routines for end users to facilitate best-practice use of data management tools.
Provide advanced analytics support to help advancing the strategic objectives and initiatives of the organizations.
Use cross sectoral information systems (Cerner, Meditech) and Databases (Oracle, SQLServer, MySQL) with minimal supervision.
Propose and evaluate process improvements and operational efficiencies by utilizing knowledge of current trends, new and emerging technologies, critical analysis of business challenges and needs requirements, and the use of available tools and resources to ensure health information technologies support safe and efficient patient care.
Share on-call duties with other members of the informatics team during business and non-business hours
Performs other position related duties as required
Job Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field
6+ years of experience as an analyst or engineer in the data/BI and database space
Experience working directly with clinical and business stakeholders to translate data and clinical/business requirements into functional and technical specifications
Hands-on experience with Oracle, SQLServer, MySQL and other databases
Hands-on experience with various data ETL, processing and reporting tools
Hands-on experience with various data warehouse systems, and data warehouse reporting technology
Hands-on experience with Shell, Python, Java or other modern programming language
Demonstrated experience in Linux and Windows
Experience working with source control and change control procedures
Ability to work as part of a multidisciplinary team and to establish and build effective working relationships, functioning both independently as well as part of a team
Strong interpersonal and communications skills (written and verbal) with demonstrated attention to detail
Strong leadership and mentoring/coaching qualities with the ability to engage, motivate and lead small to large teams, resolve team conflicts and work collaboratively to achieve overarching project goals
Results oriented and able to work effectively in a fast-paced multi-tasking environment
Demonstrated satisfactory work performance and attendance record

Title: Business Systems Analyst - GTM Business Systems
Desc:
Fastly helps people stay better connected with the things they love. Fastly's edge cloud platform enables customers to create great digital experiences quickly, securely, and reliably by processing, serving, and securing our customers' applications as close to their end-users as possible — at the edge of the Internet. The platform is designed to take advantage of the modern internet, to be programmable, and to support agile software development. Fastly's customers include many of the world's most prominent companies, including Vimeo, Pinterest, The New York Times, and GitHub.

We're building a more trustworthy Internet. Come join us.
Business Systems Analyst - GTM Business Systems

Come be an important part of our growth by founding the role of Business Systems Analyst for the Go-to-Market Business Systems part of the organization. Key responsibilities include demonstrating business applications product expertise as well as specifying and documenting technical requirements for solving the organization's process & system challenges. The work you implement will have a direct impact on our team's productivity and our organization's overall growth. You will be expected to work with our business stakeholders at all levels, using your functional/business expertise and technical proficiencies to understand the challenges they face and provide context to team leadership for work prioritization and organization. You'll work alongside the Product Manager - Business Systems on ticket intake processes, eliciting and documenting systems requirements. If you want a work environment where your ideas are welcome and contributions are recognized, this is the place for you!

What You'll Do

Use systems thinking to workshop process problems with business partners, identify solutions, and document requirements.
Follow systems analysis frameworks, patterns and practices.
Coordinate with system admins and developers to resolve technical issues.
A leader in multi-functional team projects that address strategic business issues, you'll provide guidance to the business on implementation strategies & best practices.
Create and document user stories in JIRA including acceptance criteria for application developers and admins of all levels.
Create proof of concepts and design mock-ups.
Assist in managing ticket intake process, assuring tickets are ready for stakeholder prioritization and team grooming ceremonies.
Develop test plans in collaboration with the business & demo all new feature development for accuracy of vision.
Improve the overall quality and completeness of documentation.
Influence at all levels without straight line authority.
Contribute to strategic roadmap planning activities and team process improvement to increase results.
Provide Salesforce, Zendesk, NetSuite and/or Gainsight product expertise, combining business knowledge and technical skill.
Help us grow the GTM Systems team by contributing to the development of our vision and execution of our strategies.

Nice to Have

Experience with Salesforce CPQ.
Experience working on projects that rely on integrations between Salesforce and NetSuite to facilitate the order-to-cash process.
Certified Salesforce Administrator, Certified platform app builder, CPQ certification.
Working knowledge of NetSuite, Zendesk, and Gainsight.

What We're Looking For

Solid business process engineering skills.
Business Analyst work experience, preferably in an Agile environment.
Solid understanding and ability to solution business application integrations with other systems.
Ability to create and interpret system / business requirements and prepare specification and design documents for developers.
A deep understanding of the Lead to Cash processes at scale.
Success working independently with distributed stakeholders and development teams.
The ability to discuss high-level best practices for Salesforce, Zendesk, NetSuite and/or Gainsight.
Must excel in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Partner with cross-functional leaders that address strategic business issues and create plans to apply appropriate technology solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with a pleasant, supportive, and customer-focused personality and the ability to work across all levels in an organization.
Outstanding attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Ability to follow through on sometimes ambiguous issues until resolved.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

In accordance with applicable law, Fastly's minimum base pay for this role if hired in Colorado is $94,000 per year. Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Fastly's equity plan. Final offer amount will be at the company's sole discretion and determined by multiple factors, including years and depth of experience and expertise, location and other business considerations. Note that this role is available to candidates outside of Colorado and different minimum compensation may apply.

Fastly is proud to deliver a strong total rewards program to our employees. This role is eligible to participate in the following benefits:

Health benefits (medical, dental, and vision)
Medical: Cigna or Kaiser available
Retirement benefits and employer match
Life Insurance (Basic and Voluntary Life)
Short & Long Term Disability with a buy-up LTD option
Voluntary Accident & Critical Illness benefits
Flex Spending Accounts & Mass Transit benefits
Open Vacation Policy
Sick Time
Generous leave benefits (medical, maternity, paternity, and personal)
Paid wellness days
Employee Assistance Program
Learning & reimbursement program stipend
Mobile and internet allowance
Wellness stipend
Pet insurance

Fastly reserves the right to amend or modify for any reasons in accordance with applicable law.
Why Fastly?

We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.

We love distributed teams. Fastly's home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. In fact, 50% of our employees work outside of SF! An international remote culture is in our DNA.

We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits like up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave, options for free medical/dental/vision plans, and an open vacation program that enables our folks to take the time they need to recharge (some benefits may vary by location).

We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful - every day.

We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we're not 'one size fits all'. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about.

We're always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit, please apply!


Fastly is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and to providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

Employment decisions at Fastly are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Fastly encourages applicants from all backgrounds.
Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Fastly. Please inform us if you need assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Fastly collects and processes personal data submitted by job applicants in accordance with our Privacy Policy. Please see our privacy notice for job applicants.

Title: Business Planning Analyst - CSD Business Planning
Desc:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario. 
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you! 
Our Operational Support Office within Customer Service Delivery Division is seeking a Business Planning Analyst to create business intelligence tools that provides relevant and accurate operational business planning performance reports while ensuring integrity of the CSD Business Plan. This role will be responsible for configuring and implementing SharePoint improvements, designing, and automating self-serve dashboards by working with our business. This position will report to the Senior Business Planning Lead 
What will I be doing? 

Create and automate easy-to-understand visualizations to illustrate key insights and findings that communicate business performance trends and identify gaps 
Design and implement improvements to the SharePoint repository by proactively collecting stakeholder feedback to improve site usability, develop self-serve PowerBI reports and update training material 
Analyze the accuracy of the SharePoint business plan and p artner with divisional managers and leads to resolve data gaps, address user issues promptly and train new users on using the site correctly 
Conduct business plan performance reviews and streamline reporting to measure plan health and assess risk accuracy/integrity by engaging with delivery leads. 
Develop divisional business plan capacity monitoring tools and track utilization to ensure a viable workload 
Collaborate with delivery leads, managers, and executives to understand new work requests and conduct intake assessments to prioritize new requests 
Support the development of the Division’s operating and capital budget planning and reporting activities to deliver business plan objectives 
Conduct audits on the integrity and stability the SharePoint business plan

Title: Data Analyst
Desc:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Role Summary
Reporting within the Strategy & Analytics team, the Data Analyst is responsible for reviewing large quantities of data to help generate value for a variety of functions, develop enhanced personalized reporting, produce innovative and effective methods of analyzing data using a variety of mathematical models, performing ongoing and periodic analysis of Sun Life Global Investment's block of business, and testing and reporting related to sales activity across our various sales partners.
What will you do?
Analyze large quantities of data and help create value for a variety of business functions through both descriptive / diagnostic reporting and deriving analytical insights
Create data tools and optimize data pipelines using AWS ETL technologies
Work with business partners throughout the organization (Sales, Marketing, Finance, Operations, Actuarial, Product, etc.) to conduct ad-hoc reporting on a multitude of metrics using a variety of descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive methods
Prepare / compile ongoing trend reporting as required (daily, weekly, and monthly) as well as provide drawn conclusions from the reports.
Improve efficiency of existing business processes through application of procedural automation methods using VBA.
Participates in projects, as needed.
What will you need to succeed?
University degree in a Business, Finance, Math/Statistics, Computer science, Analytics-related discipline
3+ years experience with data analysis and visualization platforms such as Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, Microsoft with a proven track record of creating informative and interactive dashboards
2+ years of experience of working with data analysis / big data technologies (SAS, Python, R, SQL, Hadoop, Zeppelin, AWS, Hive)
Experience in architecting data pipelines and solutions for both streaming and batch integrations using tools/frameworks like AWS Glue ETL, Lambda, Google Cloud DataFlow, Azure Data Factory etc.
Effective and concise oral and written story-telling and insights communication skills to provide simplified explanations of complex analytical methodologies and findings.
Strong research, problem solving and analytical skills.
Proven track record of working in a team-oriented collaborative environment
Proven experience with VBA, SQL as well as advanced Excel.
Strong experience in data transformation and cleansing through data profiling and root cause analysis
Experience balancing multiple projects
What will be nice to have?
Related work experience in an analytical role in Financial/Banking industry is a strong asset
Experience with CRM tools or Salesforce specifically
Strong mutual fund and market-based insurance product knowledge
Unique requirements:
Some travel may be required.
Extra hours may be required during the quarter-end reporting periods and during periods with high mutual fund trading volumes.
What is in it for you?
Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.
Sun Life is committed to the health and safety of all those in our workplaces and our communities. In accordance with Sun Life’s Vaccination Policy (Canada):
Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st. Employees in these roles may participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program as an alternative until April 30th.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Salary Range:
48,100/48 100 - 78,600/78 600
Job Category:
Advanced Analytics
Posting End Date:
14/04/2022

Title: Analyst - Data valorization
Desc:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.

 You use your analytical skills and extensive knowledge of your line of business to work on complex business projects and initiatives using data from different databases. You prepare recommendations, solutions and action plans based on the organization’s objectives and priorities.
  
 Your projects and initiatives require extensive knowledge of your field.
  
 You serve as a data use resource for various stakeholders. You interact with stakeholders working in other fields to understand needs, and present and explain analysis results.

Title: GROWTH AND YIELD DATA ANALYST
Desc:
Do you have strong research and statistical skills? If so, Science and Research Branch is looking for a person to provide specialized scientific, statistical and technical support to forest productivity and growth and yield modelling projects.

The Forest Research and Monitoring Section at the Ontario Forest Research Institute (OFRI) is committed to providing scientific leadership and excellence in forest research, program development, and technology transfer to a range of natural resource clients in Ontario. We work in support of policy development and operational resource management to contribute to the management of Ontario's forest ecosystems. Major emphases include understanding ecosystem processes, patterns and diversity; evaluating disturbance effects and recovery of forest ecosystems; developing alternative silvicultural practices to achieve sustainable forestry objectives; and developing methods and tools to support sustainable resource use decisions. We work in partnership with our clients and in cooperation with other scientific organizations to ensure the effectiveness of our efforts.

Note: The successful candidate will have the option of working from the following satellite office locations:


1235 Queen St E, Sault Ste Marie300 Water St, Peterborough5520 Hwy 101 E, South Porcupine421 James St. South Suite 103, Thunder Bay
What can I expect to do in this role?
In this role, you will,:

Carry out complex analysis of research data using scientifically sound quantitative methods;Develop statistical, predictive, and mathematical models;Analyze and interpret study results, prepare data summaries, synthesize literature, write reports and assist with manuscripts for publication;
Design and maintain databases and file structures for both data and file management.
How do I qualify?
Technical Knowledge:You demonstrate sound theoretical knowledge of applied mathematics, analytical statistics, and modeling.You are familiar with remotely sensed data acquisition and analysis, and of field based environmental data collection and analysis;You have knowledge of the ecology of boreal and temperate terrestrial ecosystems;You have an understanding of the Occupational Health and Safety Act.
Computer Proficiency:You demonstrate advanced skills in computer programming techniques and languages to manage large databases, develop tools and calibrate and adapt models;You have knowledge of geographical information systems, large database management, spreadsheet, word processing, and graphics software.
Statistical and Planning Skills:You are able to conduct analysis and model biological, environmental, and physical processes;
You can conduct scientific research;You have experience with data management tools and techniques;You demonstrate excellent organizational and planning skills.
Communication Skills:You have effective oral and written communication skills;.You are able to explain modeling techniques, mathematics, and scientific methods and results to diverse audiences.

OPS Commitment to diversity, inclusion, accessibility, and anti- racism:
We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.
We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.
Visit the OPS Anti-Racism Policy and the OPS Diversity and Inclusion Blueprint pages to learn more about the OPS commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.

Title: Business Analyst Intern
Desc:
BE authentic . BE influential . BE the expert . Be all that and more at Colliers. 

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed. 
Purpose of Position 
This is position for a Technology & Data Intern Business Analyst with a desire to pursue a career within the commercial real estate industry. 

Essential Functions & Job Duties 

Gain an understanding of the Colliers business processes and supporting applications 
Assist with first- and second-line end-user support 
Assist with process improvements for Master Data Management, CRM, and Marketing systems 
Assist with implementation of innovative technology across the portfolio 
Elicit requirements from business stakeholders to contribute to current and future projects 
Support the application design process from a process and technical perspective 


Required Education, Experience, and Skills 

Either have or are working towards a bachelor’s degree in business administration, computer science, or related field 
An analytical self-starter, creative thinker, and fast learner to take the initiative to identifying issues and raising them to management, as well as offering potential solutions 
Possesses an understanding of general business language and processes 
Possesses the ability to work independently, proactively, and as part of a team 
Must be comfortable with uncertainty, and adapt to changing priorities and timelines 
Demonstrated appetite for learning, enjoys trying new things to expand your skillset 
An active listener to work with a vast array of information, coupled with the ability to present it in a professional and organized manner 
    
Audience awareness, the ability to communicate in technical and non-technical language 

Strong organization skills to allocate one’s time effectively and meet tight deadlines 
Experience or exposure to any of the following: 
    
CRM Solutions, Dynamics 365 CRM preferred 
PowerBI or similar data visualization or dashboarding tool 
Machine Learning and/or AI 
Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills 
Test plan creation and execution 
Email Marketing process and Systems 
MS Azure, MS SQL Query Skills with exposure to SSRS and SSIS 
ServiceNow 
Any experience with application/web development 


BE who you are and what you want to be with Colliers. We’d love to meet you. Apply today to join our team. 

Please be aware that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Colliers professionals in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated to attend any Colliers workplace. As a condition of commencing any role, you will be required to self-report your vaccination status and provide verifying documentation. Should you require medical or religious accommodation related to vaccination please discuss with your Talent Acquisition Advisor. 
 Direct applicants only please, no agencies. 
 Colliers is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce. Colliers encourages applications from all qualified individuals and will accommodate applicants' disability-related needs, up to the point of undue hardship, throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the recruitment team by email at careers@colliers.com.

Title: Inventory Control Analyst
Desc: GENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIESThe Inventory Control Analyst is responsible for overseeing inventory-related issues which include running inventory reports, discovering and analyzing discrepancies in the inventory data, and improving the inventory control systems. The Inventory Control Analyst is also responsible for ensuring data integrity, accurate reporting, and maintenance of all parameters for warehouse layouts. This role will also partner with the Accounts Payable team to ensure the accurate tracking of all inventory transactions.SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIESMonitor and control inventory integrity and control warehouse layoutsUpdate data, run reports and identify discrepancies while maintaining inventory control records, and regular management reportsAnalyze actual sales compared to forecast and identify cause/effect relationship of variancesPerform daily cycle counts, reconcile, and monitor inventory accuracy while resolving any errors or discrepancies in a timely mannerMake recommendations for corrective actions based on on-going analysisObserve all safety rules in performance of dutiesQUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTSUniversity degree or college diploma, preferably in a related fieldStrong analytical skills, attention to detail and understanding of data managementUnderstanding of technical aspects of warehouse operations including storage solutionsThorough knowledge and understanding of bulk and finish goods processesStrong problem solver, able to create solutions to challenges in an expedient mannerAble to communicate effectively with various organizational levels including warehouse floor employees and customersAdvanced skills in MS ExcelAbility to travel and work at other locations as requiredPrevious work experience in a related field would be a strong assetKnowledge of ERP systems an assetAble to work Monday to Friday, afternoon availability requiredJob Types: Full-time, PermanentAdditional pay:Overtime payBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsDental careDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programExtended health careLife insuranceOn-site parkingPaid time offRRSP matchVision careSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayApplication question(s):Do you have availability for some afternoon availability as well?Experience:Inventory control: 3 years (required)Application deadline: 2022-04-29

Title: Analyst, Global Inventory Management
Desc:
At BRP, we create new ways to move people, where experience is measured in emotion rather than distance. All over the world, our products, successes and aspirations reflect the exceptional expertise of our people. Want to be part of the adventure?

We are looking for a Global Inventory Management Analyst reporting to the Global Inventory and Deployment Manager to help us meet our business needs through sound inventory management. In this role, you will have a major impact in supporting the growth of the organization by optimizing our procurement, inventory and deployment policies for BRP's parts and accessories distribution centers.

ADVANCE YOUR CAREER

By working at BRP, you will develop within an environment at the cutting edge of technology and will be able to apply your analytical mind to complex, large-scale projects. You will be part of an experienced team and will have access to numerous training opportunities to keep your skills up to date.

YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:
Perform data analysis to support operational and strategic decisions.

Define and improve processes/tools to support inventory management and deployment policies with a view to continuous improvement.

Collaborate with various positions to ensure proper management of inventory levels.

Define and produce key performance indicators and use them to implement concrete action plans.

Help transform the department, including by contributing to the implementation of the SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) system.

TO THRIVE IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL NEED TO HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES:

2 years’ experience in a data analysis, business intelligence or inventory management role

Background in supply chain, engineering or related field.

Advanced knowledge of Excel and intermediate knowledge of Power BI (or other data visualization tool)

Proficient written and oral communication (in French and English)

Positive attitude and strong analytical mind.

Is this you? We look forward to receiving your application!

WE CAN OFFER YOU:
A very competitive salary

An annual bonus

A generous allowance of paid leave

An annual contribution to a pension plan

A group insurance plan fully covered by BRP

Significant discounts on our products

A personalized career progression plan

Access to an online training platform

Team building activities

Access to a gym

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours.

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Desc: Company ProfileHome Capital Group Inc., together with its operating subsidiary Home Trust Company, has developed a track record of success as Canada’s leading alternative lender. Building on the demonstrated strength of its core residential mortgage lending business, the Company also offers complementary lending services, as well as highly competitive deposit investment products. Home Trust’s core values are respect, trust, and integrity.The Data & Analytics (D&A) team is part of IT and provides services that focus on one of our company’s most important assets - information. The D&A team conceives, designs, develops, implements, and supports systems and processes to capture, integrate, distribute, and analyse data across our enterprise. Data & Analytics is comprised of three teams (Reporting & Analytics, Data Management Office (DMO), and Electronic Content Management (ECM)) with a scope of service that realizes the following capabilities: Data Strategy & Architecture, Data Management, Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Records Management and ECM.Position OverviewAs a member of the Data & Analytics team, the Data Governance Analyst will support developing the maturity of data governance disciplines and practices at Home Trust, focusing on competencies for data stewardship and metadata management.This role requires the ability to work independently on multiple simultaneous tasks and projects within a challenging fast-paced team and customer-oriented environment. We are looking for a candidate with a strong passion for getting things done and to learn about data and analytics.The key areas of focus for this role are: Metadata Management – Contributes to the development of best practices and processes for the collection, documentation and dissimilation of business knowledge about HTC data, including business terms, definitions and rules. This role will work closely with the Data Management & Analytics team, Data Stewards, other business stakeholders and IT teams to ensure business metadata is effectively and accurately captured and maintained, and to provide support for leveraging the knowledge on an on-going basis.Business Glossary – Administration and maintenance of the Glossary tool, user education and stakeholder communications for updates.Support Activities – Support when necessary for reporting, dashboard, and other data governance activities including support request intake, business data requirements analysis, data quality analysis, data validation and cleansing.Position ResponsibilitiesData Governance Activities (50%): Publish and maintain business information about our data, including terms, definitions, and rules, in a central glossary as a reference tool for all employeesFoster solid working relationships with Data Stewards to ensure a high level of service, knowledge sharing and to understand the needs and expectations of data users.Support the centralized intake service for data governance supportSupport the Funding Initiative Task Force by providing data quality management and metadata management for strategic Treasury funding facilities while meeting critical path timelinesProject Management and Continuous Improvement Activities (20%):Work closely with project teams to ensure effective capture of new metadata and changes to metadata during the project lifecycle.Ensure appropriate Data Stewardship involvement for metadata reviews and sign-offsGovernance and Control (15%): Deliver data management and governance reporting and metrics for tracking levels and progressRisk and Compliance (15%): Ensure all assigned processes and procedures are documented and updated as practices changeFormal EducationPost secondary degree or diploma required (University degree preferred)Related Experience1-3 years of relevant Data Management or regulated Financial Services experienceProven experience with requirements gathering and analysisKnowledge of SAP is an assetSkills: Knowledge of leading practices, technology, metrics and controls for Data Stewardship, Data Quality Management and Metadata Management is an assetProven ability to learn new technology/technical tools (i.e. SAP, Microsoft Power BI, Informatica)Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsHighly organized and extremely detail oriented with continuous attention to qualityStrong verbal and written communication skills, proven ability to collaborate and write clear and concise documentationDemonstrated excellence in relationship building with different roles and departmentsAble to multi-task and function independently in a fast-paced, deadline-driven work environmentExcellent knowledge of MS Office and Excel skillsAppropriate capability metrics and reporting will be maintained to ensure visibility and tracking of progress and value.The role requires working with and safeguarding highly confidential and sensitive information.Position ComplexitiesSome work beyond standard hoursAcknowledgementAll employees of Home Capital Group Inc. must comply with all applicable Home Capital Group Inc, Home Trust Company, and specific Line of Business policies, standards, guidelines and controls. Additionally, all employees are obligated to become familiar with Home’s risk management framework and understand the operational risk management requirements within their specific business. Employees are also expected to understand and comply with the Company’s Code of Business Conduct & Ethics Policy at all times and escalate any issues or concerns through various reporting channels (i.e. Ombudsman, Compliance Hotline, Whistleblower Policy, etc).Job Type: Full-time

Title: Community Prog. Analyst - PT
Desc:
HAMILTON POLICE SERVICE
 TOGETHER | STRONGER | SAFER



The Hamilton Police Service (HPS) provides policing to over 540,000 residents in the City of Hamilton. In 2018, HPS answered over 199,430 emergency calls for assistance from our community. We have over 1,240 employees in Sworn and Civilian roles. Our mission is to be a trusted partner in delivering public safety.






JOB POSTING







 
HAMILTON POLICE SERVICE (HPS)
 CIVILIAN JOB OPPORTUNITY
 COMMUNITY PROGRAM ANALYST
 Temporary Assignment
 Job Title: Community Program Analyst (Temporary Assignment)
 Reports to: Manager of Analytics
 Primary Job Location: Central Police Station, 155 King William St, Hamilton, ON
 Hours of Work: Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.
 Salary Range: Schedule 8E - $71,896 - $84,591 per annum (As of January 1, 2021)
 Posting Date: April 20, 2022
 JOB SUMMARY
 Under the direction of the Manager of Analytics, the Community Program Analyst will be responsible for analytics to support the role and data needs of Hamilton Police in contributing to Hamilton’s housing and homelessness strategies. 
The Community Program Analyst will work with various police and non-police data, as well as conduct research in order to provide recommendations to support strategic and operational needs. The Community Program Analyst will collaborate with other agency analysts to support knowledge translation and anonymized data sharing to address community policing matters intersecting with social and health needs. The Community Program Analyst will be responsible for ensuring compliance with privacy legislation and data safeguards that protect the privacy and integrity of individuals and communities represented in both police and community datasets. This is a 1-year pilot project.
 GENERAL DUTIES

Establishes key performance indicators, routine reports and dashboards to measure effectiveness of the Social Navigator program and HPS’ strategic priorities.
Conducts ad-hoc analysis for various internal and external members.
Creates analytical products using various tools, data, and information to summarize and synthesize key insights and recommendations to various stakeholders.
Collaborates with internal and external peers to enable knowledge translation between partner agencies and internal members.
Assesses key internal and external data sources, conducts gap analysis and devises processes to address data gaps required for managing community-based policing issues.
Maintains analytical databases and information as it pertains to community-based policing issues and in accordance to privacy legislation.
Evaluate existing processes and systems, research alternatives and recommend modifications or new processes in order to achieve organizational and community goals.
Researches and reviews new analytical techniques and crime trends through professional reading, completion of training courses, and by attending seminars, workshops and conferences.
Perform other duties, as assigned, which are related to the major responsibilities of the job.

 REQUIREMENTS
 EDUCATION: Minimum three (3) year University Degree 
EXPERIENCE: Must possess four (4) months of work experience in analysis and reporting
 CERTIFICATES/LICENSES/APPRENTICESHIPS: 

Valid Class G Driver’s License, or the equivalent, with no more than six (6) accumulated demerit points, permitting you to drive an automobile in Ontario with full driving privileges would be an asset.

 REQUIRED TECHNICAL SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:

Ability to learn and work with a wide variety of reporting and analytical software (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Advanced Excel, Power Pivot, SPSS, SAS etc.) is required.
Experience with mapping and spatial analysis using GIS software (e.g. MapInfo, Arc GIS etc.) or equivalent is an asset.
Working knowledge of relational database models and Structured Query Language (SQL) is an asset. 
Must possess excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate and present complex information in an easily understood manner.
Experience and demonstrated ability with project coordination and consultation with multidisciplinary teams to meet deliverables in a timely fashion.
Experience providing analytical support to various levels of an organization, as well as experience in supporting large complex data analysis to support process improvement and strategic initiatives.
Ability to maintain a high degree of discretion and confidentiality. 

APPLICATION DEADLINE & INSTRUCTIONS
 Applications (i.e. cover letter and resume – all one document) are to be submitted via the City of Hamilton Careers website before 11:59 PM on April 20, 2022.
 If you are interested in this position, please submit your application (i.e. cover letter and resume) to the City of Hamilton Careers website (https://www.hamilton.ca/jobs-city/current-opportunities). Recruitment process could include testing, assessments, interviews and/or presentations. A full background and reference check will be required for hire.
 We are unable to respond to all applicants. The Hamilton Police Service is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation for testing, interview, or employment purposes.
 If hired, the incumbent shall comply with all Health and Safety Policies and Practices for their position and the workplace. By applying, you agree that the statements made by you are true, complete, and correct to the best of your knowledge. Further, you understand that any falsification of statements, misrepresentations, and/or deliberate omission or concealment of information may be considered just cause for dismissal.

Title: Business Analyst I, OPL
Desc:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.











      About the role
      










We are currently looking for a Business Analyst for our Operations and Planning department, which would play an important role in our growth.
Are you energized at the idea of working in an environment where you are able to evaluate and analyze information? Are you eager to get your foot in the door with a national industry-leading organization? Do you want to work in an environment that believes in growth and development and offers various career opportunities? Are you interested in being at the center of all the key strategies of the organization and moving those projects forward? Do you want to be a part of one of the most exciting teams in the organization?
If you answered yes, to any of the above questions, we might be exactly what you are looking for!
WORKPLACE: Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa Blvd), Quebec (5700, des Galeries) or St-Hyacinthe (2450, Girouard Ouest Street)
What you’ll do here:
The Operations and Planning department is seeking individuals with exceptional analytical and organizational skills for a variety of Business Analyst positions, ranging from Junior - Intermediate - and Senior Business Analysts. These activities include but are not limited to eliciting and documenting business requirements and supporting the project team.

Plan and coordinate project activities related to organizational requirements or changes.
Act as a intermediary between I.T., users and managers from different hierarchical levels.
Obtain requirements from business communities using techniques such as interview and work sessions.
Analyze complex needs, information obtained from various sources, detail the high-level information and provide users with recommendations to their problems.
Document requirements obtained from business community using defined templates.
Ensure the link between the business units, the technology teams and the support team.
Act as PO if required
Organise and facilitate working session with experts from different fields.
Responsible for improving productivity and reducing risks and high costs through effective analysis.
Identify the need for change to assess and communicate their impact.
Support the Quality Assurance team during Test Planning and Execution












      Qualifications
      










What you bring to the table:

Bachelor Degree or a combination of education & relevant experience will be considered.
Minimum one year relevant business analysis and requirements elicitation/documentation experience
Experience in a variety of Requirements gathering methodologies,
Experience with an Agile approach, Product Owner role is an asset
Experience in complex business environments where multiple systems interact
Superior organizational skills in order to manage projects and balance multiple demands and deadlines.
Proven analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential.
Insurance industry experience is an asset.
Bilingualism (French/English) is required
Travelling might be required – 15%

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career

Flexible Work Arrangements
Right now, we support 100% remote work, if your role permits. We anticipate that in early 2022, we’ll be moving to a hybrid approach which gives us the best of both worlds – a mix of home and in-office workdays.











      Closing Statement
      










We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard.
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs.
Background Checks
As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us. We want Intact to be a great place to work! This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.
Internal Candidates
For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.
Eligibility to Work in Canada
It’s important that you are legally eligible to work in Canada at the time an offer of employment is made. You may be requested to provide proof of eligibility at that time.

Title: Data Integration Analyst (Hybrid Opportunity)
Desc:
What you can expect in a typical day
The Data Integration Analyst works collaboratively with business stakeholders, vendors, and other members of IT to define, build, test and support the implementation of IT solutions related to our data integration and data analytics platforms. This role is responsible for identifying business requirements, understanding issues, propose recommended solutions and participate in projects to implement them. This role requires excellent communication with stakeholders and our vendors to ensure alignment, resolve issues, optimize existing solutions, and/or scoping future enhancements. This role also works with and mentors junior Data Integration Analysts as they develop their skills and experience. Please note that this position will require shift flexibility and rotational on-call work.
What we offer:
Competitive salary, bonus and pension plan
Flexible benefits, including a Health Spending Account
Flexible work program
Wellness support, including annual wellness allowance and paid personal care days
Paid vacation and vacation purchasing
Personal and professional development opportunities
Named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for six consecutive years
Your roles and responsibilities:
Leverage existing and potential relationships to facilitate solutions.
Provide constructive and well thought out feedback within team, both horizontally and vertically within an organization.
Problem solve and troubleshoot moderate to complex data and/or software issues in a timely manner.
Collaborate with stakeholders at any level to identify incident requirements, understand issues, review possible solutions and present recommendations.
Support the development of project plans, gathering requirements and creating broad scopes. Participate in projects to implement new solutions or enhancements.
Evaluate the approach to deal with issues, either undertaking to resolve or by escalating issues with other IT team members and vendors.
Support less experienced Data Integration Analysts by providing guidance and mentoring them.
Adhere to all service management best practices on an individual level.
Create and provide ongoing maintenance of support documentation as required.
Monitor, analyze, and troubleshoot most complex data solutions for potential issues and keep them running reliably.
Support application patches, upgrades, and installation when required.
Communicate the value of a process centric approach to solving problems and taking advantage of opportunities.
Work closely with business subject matter experts to understand challenges faced that could have a portion of the solution based on technology.
Professional skills
Ability to mentor junior members of the team
Proven troubleshooting skills
Ability to multi-task and shift priorities as required
Able to set priorities based on business and stakeholder
Proven time management and organizational skills
Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills
Aptitude to embrace ongoing change in technology
Sense of urgency in completing tasks as assigned
Comfortable working with senior leadership as stakeholders.
Ability to bring existing skills and experience to any improve any business problem.
The ability to be prepared and ask intelligent and compelling questions when in any meeting.
Comfortable working in a team environment and able to take responsibility individually.
A desire to improve processes. Inefficiencies bother you.
An interest in learning about new areas of the business.
Prior experience understanding and managing the lifecycle of technology solutions.
An understanding of why processes that are fit-for-purpose, improve the outcome and are worth the effort to follow.
Travel
Travel is not a requirement for this role.
Education and experience
Undergraduate Degree or College diploma in related field
Minimum of 3 Years in enterprise-level application development and integration
Technically fluent in programming languages, including Java, SQL, DOS/Shell Scripting
Hands-on experience with integration tools such as Talend, Informatica, WBIMB, Mulesoft, TIBCO, WSO2
Knowledge of Service-Oriented Architecture, Enterprise Service Bus, and Enterprise Integration Patterns
Knowledge of relational database design and management techniques
Competency with XML and JSON constructs
Confidence and experience with API protocols and schemas such as SOAP and REST
Experience with securing integration scenarios using appropriate authentication, authorization, non-repudiation, and data encryption methods
Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies
Knowledge of network protocols and standards
Knowledge of Master Data Management an asset
Experience with designing, building, installing, configuring, and supporting data warehouses an asset
 Please note that this position will require shift flexibility and rotational on-call work.
Irving Oil supports a diverse and inclusive work environment and welcomes applications from all qualified applicants.

Title: Analyst, ASG
Desc:
Responsible to ensure the operational effectiveness and excellence of the Account Services Group Business Unit. Assist in the creation of sophisticated and flexible financial and data-mining models that are responsive to the diverse needs of our airline client base. The main focus of this position is data analysis. 
  Essential Duties and Responsibilities : 

Perform continuous audits to ensure standard, consistent and quality master data in catering systems is valid and correct. 
Interface with several internal groups, including the buyers and SAP coordinators across multiple kitchens, members of the Business Process Improvement team, Pricing, Billing, and Menu Specification analysts for assigned accounts. 
Collect and interpret menu specifications for assigned accounts, and research and resolve any discrepancies. 
Work with JIRA issue reporting and coverage of on call (off hours, weekends approximately 7 weeks). 
Partnering with your assigned airline Account Executives, Gate Gourmet units, the Pricing and Data management and Collections/Credit Department to identify our common problems and limit their frequency and volume. 
Working closely with your supervisor, Pricing and Data Analysts and our customers to monitor and interpret any changes to airline specifications ensuring lead times are met upstream. 
Partner with your supervisor to find new ways to improve our systems and process. 


ASG Core Competencies 
Demonstration and or proven success in 2 of the 10 following ASG, job competencies: 

Analysis and Reporting 
Business Acumen, Planning and Management 
Communication and Presentation 
Champions Diversity & Inclusion 
Customer Focus and Relationship Building 
Champion for Change 
Influencing 
Information and Technology Proficiency 
Leadership 
Problem Solving and Decision Making 


Education : 

Bachelor's Degree required, from an accredited university or equivalent 
Computer Science / Engineering / Finance / Mathematics background preferred 


Desired Work Experience : 

3 years or more previous demonstrated analyst work experience. 
Proven experience within an SAP environment. 
Work experience in an operations or manufacturing environment 
Work experience in a food production or food service environment 
Experience working within a cross-functional team 
Prior training and development experience preferred 


Job Skills : 

Must be able to demonstrate proficiency in one of three core job functions (Billing, Data, Pricing) 
Must demonstrate and have basic skills in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Word, Excel, and Outlook. 

Strong Visual Basic and SQL coding skills would be an asset. 

Must have solid analytical skills. 
Display an outstanding work ethic. 
Must work effectively in a team based environment. 
Must have the ability and desire to meet required timelines. 
Strong mathematical aptitude. 


Communication Skills : 

Ability to communicate well with internal and external customers, verbally and in writing. 


Work Demands: 

Regular and on-time attendance. 
Must be willing to participate in an on-call rotation that would involve evening and weekend work approximately once every two months. 
Occasional travel by conventional means including aircraft, motor vehicle and the like within the region and to other locations as required up to 25 %. 


Environmental Requirements : 

Regular office environment. 


Organization Structure 

Direct Line Manager (Title): 1 (Mgr, Roconciliation or Mgr, ASG Analysis) 
Dotted Line Manager (Title, if applicable): N/A 
Number of Direct Reports: N/A 
Number of Dotted Line Reports: N/A 
Estimated Total Size of Team: varies 


Demonstrated Competencies to be Successful in the Position : 

Thinking - Information search and analysis, problem resolution skills 
Engaging - understanding others, team leadership, developing people 
Inspiring - influencing and building relationships, motivating and inspiring, communicating effectively

Title: Sr Data & BI Analyst, CAN
Desc:
At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.
Within Edward Jones Canada, we are establishing a Data Analytics capability to service the analytical priorities of all functional areas within Canada. The primary purpose is to increase data acumen across Home Office and our branch teams, and incorporate analytics into our decision-making and prioritization. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and evolving best in class analytics in partnership with functional areas to determine business needs and recommended solutions.


Do you like thinking outside the box? Are you a big picture thinker? This is the kind of thinking Edward Jones Canada - Data Analytics needs to grow impact and enhance both client and branch experience.

Flexible Work Arrangements available - Onsite, Hybrid and Home based

Business Intelligence (BI):
Build specialized reporting packages, dashboards, and scorecards to inform senior leaders and functional areas.
Validate the quality and integrity of data included in all reporting; ability to test and maintain BI products developed while following governance procedures.
Storytelling & Communication:
Generate and incorporate insights into a cohesive story that clearly addresses business questions and influences decision making.
Effectively lead the creation and communication of tailored messages to influence senior leaders regarding analytic ideas, approach, key takeaways and actionable insights.
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences.
Business Understanding:
Maintain a strong understanding of division results and business drivers; understanding to analytic approach to influence key strategies and business performance.
Drive measurement, improvement and optimization strategies by connecting business activity to outcomes that will help achieve stated goals.
Business Consulting & Data Coaching:
Develop and manage business relationships with project team members and senior leaders across the organization.
Consult with business owners to understand the business problem; independently identify the appropriate analytic approach to solve the problem.
Provide mentorship and feedback to others on analytic approach and leverage systems thinking to connect work to other strategic initiatives.
Serve as a functional and technical data subject matter expert; educate senior and executive leaders across the firm on analytical concepts and best practices.
Analysis:
Understand and apply statistical concept; proactively identify opportunities with impact where analytics can inform the business.
Provide actionable insights to support business decisions and strategy by performing root cause, exploratory, sensitivity and scenario analysis, hypothesis testing, economic modeling and data visualization to identify trends for business needs
Actively participate in industry and trade data and analytic communities in order to bring fresh ideas to the organization.
Data:
Define business and data requirements for analytic efforts while building cross-functional relationships
Build and maintain an understanding of data flows, sources, and data transformations across multiple domains; extract, merge, cleanse and transform data from multiple sources as needed for analysis.
Apply critical thinking to pressure test and validate logic and outputs against known sources and understanding of business.
Proactively identify data quality issues and collaborate with other subject matter experts to identify solutions.
Operational Efficiency:
Document, monitor, and improve processes and controls related to areas of responsibility.
Proactively identify opportunities for efficiency with moderate to broad impact and visibility, propose solutions to relevant parties and drive implementation of solutions.
Bachelor's Degree required in relevant discipline, preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or Analytics or relevant work experience.
5+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, Statistics
Canadian Securities Course (CSC) an asset
Strong analytical, critical and systems thinking required.
Apply innovation and creativity to improve work efficiency; effective in managing multiple priorities with strong organization and time management skills.
Experience with programming languages such as SQL & Python required. R would be an asset.
Proficiency interacting with various database and file storage systems (Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL).
Understanding of statistical concepts and analytic techniques/types (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive).
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access); advanced knowledge of VBAs, Macros
Experience with Data Visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBi, or QlikView.

Title: Corporate Banking Analyst
Desc:
The Corporate Banking Analyst Position within Citi’s Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory group (“BCMA”) is an entry-level position responsible for supporting Senior Bankers on financing-related transaction execution, relationship management and periodic credit reviews for major Canadian institutional clients. The overall objective of the Corporate Banking team is to help clients leverage the Citi Platform while efficiently deploying the firm's capital through evaluation and management of risk.
The role affords the successful candidate with an opportunity to gain exposure to clients belonging to diversified industry groups and a large array of client solutions (Lending, Hedging, Capital Markets Origination, Cash Management, and more).
Different from a traditional corporate banking role, this role involves supporting Senior Corporate Banking Officers to cover clients in multiple industry clusters – such as consumer, technology, telecommunications, metals & mining, aviation, and industrials – and help them with various capital-markets-based or bank-led-financing solutions. Assisting the team with capital structure advisory efforts, involving a full spectrum of traditional debt products and innovative structured debt offerings, is an integral part of the job requirement. Monitoring of credit profiles, preparing materials for client marketing and internal risk management solutions are other important aspect of the day-to-day responsibilities.
Responsibilities:
Conduct extensive analysis to evaluate a client’s credit profile, including accounting, financial and business analysis, industry and economic research as well as financial modelling
Support Senior Corporate Banking Officers in executing transactions by liaising with various internal and external counterparties
Prepare recommendation memos for transaction approval and periodic credit reviews
Support Senior Corporate Banking Officers with relationship management, including monitoring our clients’ ongoing performance and update relationship managers with notable developments, while developing an understanding around client needs and business opportunities
Organize and analyze data in preparation of client pitches in collaboration with partners across Citi
Contribute to strategic planning initiatives
Participate in internal projects and assignments as necessary
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
Excellent research and analytical skills, including a solid understanding of financial statements and accounting concepts, as well as basic financial modelling skills
1-2 years of previous work experience in Corporate Banking, Investment Banking or Private Equity is desired
Concentrated coursework in Accounting, Finance, Economics and/or closely related areas
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Understanding of Corporate Banking Business
Demonstrated planning and organizational skills and work effectively in a team environment
Bilingual proficiency is preferred but not required
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience
Location:
Toronto, Canada
Application Requirements:
A Cover Letter accompanying the application is highly recommended
More about Corporate Banking at Citi
Our relationship bankers have a comprehensive understanding of the wide range of complex financial issues facing our clients. Combined with an appreciation of the broad set of services offered by Citi, this understanding allows us to effectively deliver innovative solutions to our clients, wherever they are located.
Corporate Bank's relationship bankers partner with product specialists to provide a full array of corporate banking solutions, from cash management, foreign exchange, trade finance, custody, clearing and loans, to capital markets, derivatives, and structured products. They also partner with our investment bankers to deliver investment banking capabilities to our relationship clients.
The Corporate Bank is organized primarily along industry lines and serves clients in more than 100 countries. This organizational model draws upon a deep understanding of industry trends and market knowledge, based on a local presence dating back 100 years in many of these markets, including Canada. It also enables us to provide a steady stream of innovative cross border and local financial solutions tailored to the specific needs of our clients.
-
Job Family Group:
Institutional Banking
-
Job Family:
Corporate Banking
-
Time Type:
Full time
-

Title: GBP - Data Analyst & BI Developer, Fall 2021 Co-op
Desc:
Requisition ID: 103599  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.




 GBP - Data Analyst & BI Developer





 Fall 2021 (September to December)




 
Why work for Scotiabank?

 Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services.

 This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.

 Who We Are:

 Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

 Global Business Payments (GBP) offers comprehensive business banking solutions on a global basis to small business, commercial and corporate clients of the Bank. The Business Payments Product team is responsible for enhancing the customer experience for payment products while maximizing revenue. The Business Payments team manages the following digital products:


 Electronic Funds Transfer (EFT)
 Wire Payments
 Bulk Interac Transfer
 Business Taxes


 Your Work Term At-A-Glance:

 During your internship you will be a member of the Trade Finance Team working within Global Business Payments (GBP). This team provides GBP Trade Sales with robust analytics and reporting to drive new business, enhance the customer experience, and make better data-driven decisions. This role is perfect for you if you are both a technical as well as business-oriented individual as you will assist in developing Business Intelligence Reports, data mining and other ad-hoc duties


 Provide support to the GBP Trade Finance Product team by creating and maintaining analytical tools, Power BI / Tableau / Excel reports
 Translate business needs into technical requirements, queries and modelling.
 Maintain the intake of Sales data requests and action on their own when appropriate.


 Throughout your term you’ll also have access to skill-building modules, as well as challenging work-integrated learnings - all of which come together to create a stimulating environment where you will have the chance to thrive. We want you to be a sponge and take it all in, bring your great attitude, always be authentic, and own every opportunity that comes your way. This is your time to shine.

 This role is for you if you are/have:


 University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline.
 Proficient with Microsoft Office ( Excel, Powerpoint, Word)
 Excellent analytical, written and verbal communication skills
 Experience using Business Intelligence (Tableau and Power BI) and CRM (Salesforce) tools.
 Exposure, or experience with SQL, Python and R is an asset.
 Exposure, or experience in financial business reporting and statistical modelling
 Great attention to detail, proactive and responsive to short deadlines
 Exposure to operational business processes, and well developed problem-solving and troubleshooting capabilities
 Ability to juggle multiple concurrent projects
 Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a business team


 How do I Apply?

 For students, we believe evaluating you through relationships over resumes, and are focused on learning about who you are and what you’re interested in to uncover your true potential. In short, we don’t believe resumes will provide us with an accurate depiction of what you’re truly about in order to properly assess your potential. Instead we want to get to know YOU and hear about the experiences that have shaped you. We know… this might sound crazy but we do not want you to submit your resume instead we ask that as part of your application, you complete the below:

 1) Complete your PLUM Profile here

 2) Save your PLUM Profile as PDF. Click here to learn how

 3) Complete a very short one-way video interview by clicking here (if you have already done this, you don't need to do it again)

 4) When it prompts you to submit your resume, do not attach your resume! Instead, attach your most recent transcript and your PLUM profile in one PDF under the "resume" section. Cover letters are optional.

 Note: You do not need to complete your PLUM profile or video interview multiple times if you are applying to multiple positions. Also, we have full access to your entire profile from Plum and won’t use the screenshot but it’s a great reminder for each of you to have completed it.
 We thank you all for your interest in Scotiabank! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs

 **In order to be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank and/or Tangerine, you must submit your PLUM Assessment and Video Interview. **

 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

04/17/2022

13
Expertise in integrated planning and financial and capital management practices required.
Provide business analysis and foresight on integrated, financial model-driven processes and solutions.
