Title: Master Data analyst
Desc:
Department: Information Technology
 Are you looking for a new opportunity? Let’s shape our future together!
 WE'RE ON A JOURNEY TO CREATE A WORLD OF LOVE, CONFIDENCE AND BELONGING
 The ALDO Group has been on this journey for over 40 years. We believe that our passionate associates are at the heart of our success, and that with them we will lead into our future with kindness.
 The ALDO Group is committed to diversity and inclusion, not only now, but for the long term. We strongly encourage people who are Aboriginal, racialized, have disabilities, come from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or have intersectional identities to apply for employment with us. At ALDO Group, we will always strive to take steps to create a diverse and inclusive work environment that promotes equal opportunity and accountability.#WeAreALDO


 ALDO GROUP ASSOCIATE PERKS

Recognition programs to showcase your talent!
To be part of a company that takes a stand on issues affecting people, the environment, and our partners
Summer Fridays (because Summer is for fun)
Purchase discount on merchandise sold in all our divisions.
Family & Friends events with discounts on our products
Subsidized cafeteria & daycare
Subsidized public transportation, carpooling network and free parking
On campus gym with access to a trainer
Flex schedules and telecommuting
Sick days
Attractive total compensation!


YOUR ROLE

 ROLE: How you contribute to ALDO
 As a Master Data analyst, you will create and modify master data in our systems. The Master Data analyst is responsible for executing the requests logged by our business partners in the team's backlog. You will have the opportunity to work with other IT teams to solve issues regarding the master data while being responsible for creating and updating procedures and sharing the knowledge with your peers.

 COMMITMENTS: What it means to work at ALDO
 With a presence in over 100 countries around the world, the organization operates a multi-brand retail concept. Guided on a daily basis by its purpose: A journey to create a world of love, confidence, and belonging, the ALDO Group is simply unique. What makes our culture unique is a shared admiration for innovation, excellence, a strong work ethic, entrepreneurial spirit, diversity, empathy, friendliness, and an insatiable curiosity.

 What ALDO expects you to do

 Execute standard operating procedure (SOP) with regards to Master Data
 Create and update master data in SAP
 Create and update standard operating procedure (SOP)
 Discuss and work with peers to execute a request
 Discuss with the business partners to prioritize the work based on the value
 Participate in certain projects as a subject matter expert of master data
 Occasionally, creates and updates Winshuttle scripts to support high volume requests
 Recommend and decide with their superior on any issues or special requests
 Makes decisions, takes action, and informs their superior afterward on regular requests



 DO YOU HAVE THE PROFILE WE'RE LOOKING FOR?


 Bachelor’s Degree
 1 + years of experience in Business Intelligence, Retail Analytics an asset
 Quick learner
 Leadership and ability to work with multiple stakeholders and under pressure
 Familiar with SAP ECC, PeopleSoft, Confluence, JIRA, Winshuttle and tools such as Excel, Word, PowerPoint considered a strong asset
 Great communication skills
 Collaboration and teamwork skills
 Fluent in both French & English



 Don't wait any longer, apply now, we want to meet you!
 WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT US? HERE ARE SOME FUN FACTS.
 Present in more than 100 countries, the ALDO Group has established itself with strong brands: ALDO/ALDO Accessories, Call it Spring and Globo. Guided every day by its purpose “A journey to create a world of love, trust and belonging”, the organization is simply unique. What makes our culture so one of a kind is our people’s passion for innovation, excellence, craftsmanship, entrepreneurship and diversity, as well as their empathy and friendliness. In addition, our associates all have an insatiable curiosity!

Title: Junior Database Analyst
Desc:
Reporting to the Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence the successful candidate will be responsible for monitoring, maintenance and operational support of our entire portfolio of databases. Maintain reliability, stability and data integrity of the databases. Provide support in the administration, backup, integrity and security of various SQL databases.

 Key Duties and Responsibilities:


 Monitor performance of database systems resources and query throughput
Optimize SQL Code as necessary
Monitor and maintain database storage resources
SQL Server Installation, Upgrades, Migrations and Configuration
Install database software service packs and cumulative updates as necessary
Maintain database documentation as required
Maintain and administer database security access
Perform database Ad-hoc backups and restores
Trouble shoot and resolve database connectivity issues
Proactively monitor and respond to MSSQL database Alerts.



 Qualifications:


 2 years experience as a database administrator in SQL Server environment
2 year experience in Transact SQL, DTS, SSIS package development
1 years of SQL Server database development / programming
Experience of administering SQL Server 2000, 2005 and 20008 databases
Experience with Monitoring & Diagnostic tools
Experience working with Windows server, including Active Directory and disk configurations
Bachelor's Degree (BS/BA) or equivelant combination of education and experience.



 Required Education, Knowledge and Experience:


 1-2 years of experience as a data administrator in SQL server environment
University degree – Bachelor or Masters in Commerce, Engineering, Sciences, or related
Strong analytical and critical thinking with proven ability to solve problems
Deep understanding of advanced analytics platforms, SQL, reporting tools, etc. and an ability to quickly learn new technologies to execute on business objectives
Strong business acumen with a strategic mindset and long-term perspective
Demonstrated ability to partner, collaborate, and execute cross-functionally
Ability to work autonomously and comfortable with decision making and accountability.

  If you are interested in this role and possess the above qualities, please apply with your resume and cover letter with highlights of your achievements. In addition to working with great people in a supportive work culture every day, we offer competitive compensation, excellent benefits, career advancement opportunities, and significant on-the-job training.  If you require accommodation in the hiring process, please email with your specific needs. We are committed to providing code-protected accommodation through the hiring process. Title: Cloud & Data Center Systems Support Analyst
Desc:
Position Title: Cloud & Data Center Systems Support AnalystLocation:  Flexible (Victoria, Vancouver, Regina, Calgary)Compensation:  Negotiable (depending on experience)Reports to: Service Desk Manager
Skills Overview
The role is diverse in its exposure to technology and vendors but is focused on data center support. While it is not mandatory that candidates have skills in all the areas listed below, priority consideration will be given to those that possess previous experience in several areas and desire to broaden their exposure and experience to align with the tactical and strategic directions within Charter.
Charter partners with a several top technology vendors, including Cisco Systems, Juniper, Extreme, NetApp, Microsoft/Azure and others. The candidate should come with a strong ability to learn and adapt quickly to as many as possible:

Cloud – O365, Azure, AWS and other cloud environments
Data Center - Cisco UCS, Cisco ACI, NetApp, Cisco Hyperflex, Cisco Nexus, Veeam, VMware, Nutanix.
Routing and Switching – Cisco Catalyst/ISR, Juniper EX/MX/SRX, Meraki
Microsoft – Exchange, SCCM, SQL, Active Directory, File Servers
Management Platforms – Cisco Prime, Juniper Space, SKY ATP
Automation – PowerShell, Ansible, Puppet, Python

In addition to the above, the candidates should highlight any additional relevant technical skills that may be applicable to the Charter business.
Additionally, candidates that holds CCNP Enterprise, Data Center certifications, NetApp NCDA would be preferred. The candidates should highlight any additional relevant technical skills that may be applicable to the Charter business.
Responsibilities & Accountabilities: 
Teamwork

Work cooperatively within a team to provide support to Charter customers.
Attend team huddles and be an active participant team planning activities.
Bring subject matter expertise and leadership in Cloud, Microsoft Active Directory, MS Exchange, and systems applications.
Bring subject matter expertise and leadership in Cisco UCS, NetApp, Nutanix, Veeam and VMware.
Use provided workflow tools to reflect the status of tickets, tasks, effort/labor etc.
Identify areas to create, improve and maintain Charter intellectual property in the form of configuration templates, testing guides and other tools that assist in allowing Charter to be efficient and support with high quality.
Work collaboratively within the broader team (pre-sales, architecture, project delivery) to bring your skills to bear where and when they are required.

Support Desk: 

Provides timely delivery of customer communications regarding troubleshooting and restoration of services.
Tier 2 Remote Support & incident resolution
Develops, maintains, and continually improves standardized work practices.
Work with Aligned vendors for Tier 3 Support
Assist in establishing governance, process and identify efficiencies.
Providing reports and activity updates to Team Lead / Supervisor

Culture Building and Professional Development: 

Engage deeply within the Charter company, becoming active in the company community and culture.
Attend company town halls and events, focused on bringing people together and aligning to a single vision. Participate actively when appropriate.
Use available social and collaboration tools to engage broadly with the company in a positive and constructive manner.
Provide mentorship to others in areas of subject matter expertise and personal growth and management.
Recognize Charter company values and strive to apply them to your position and personal relationship with individuals and the company itself.
Explore and seize opportunities for growth that benefit both yourself and Charter, aligning with the overall vision.
Engage strongly in professional development activities with your mentors, reporting manager and HR to ensure growth, fulfillment, and overall success for all parties.

Qualifications and Experience: 

Minimum 5 years of experience in IT & Infrastructure administration.
Proven experience providing technical design, deployment and support of Data Center Networking, Storage, Systems and Cloud based solutions.
VMware, Microsoft and Cloud environments
Competence in the configuration and troubleshooting of networking hardware, specifically switches, routers, firewalls and wireless access points considered a strong asset.
Ability to establish strong working relationships.
Demonstrated ability to obtain and hold industry certifications such as VMware VCP, Microsoft, or AWS certificates. Current certifications are not mandatory, but it is expected the candidate will obtain what is necessary as part of professional development.
Time management, organizational skills, and excellent communication skills are greatly desired.

Essential skills: 

Excellent written and oral communication skills, and able to read and write in English in a professional manner.
Ability to create technical documentation, both written and diagrammatical using tools such as Word, Power Point and Visio.
Strong interpersonal skills: proven team player with ability to deliver outstanding product/service and build relationships with clients.
Self-motivated; demonstrated ability to take initiative, effectively prioritize tasks and accomplish goals with minimal supervision.
Authorized to work in Canada.

Working Conditions: 

Full-time, Permanent
Overtime as required
Part of on-call rotation
Minimal Travel – Less than 10%
Comprehensive benefits package with profit sharing

Job Type: Full-time

You will be responsible for providing support for Jonas Construction ERP Software by monitoring ticket, responding to customer calls and resolving cases using troubleshooting skills and product knowledge to train clients on software functionality. A successful candidate requires excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills with the ability to learn quickly in a fast-paced team environment. Previous customer service experience is required. Experience in Accounting/Finance a definite asset.JOB RESPONSIBILITIESReport to the Procedural Support Manager for daily direction and the Director of Support for administration:Provide application support for an integrated ERP accounting construction software by investigating process, accounting and operational casesAnalyze data and user process to find deficiencies in process, reports or software functionalityHave the ability to keep composure under stressful situationsHarness time management skills to effectively and efficiently resolve multiple client issuesBe driven by results to achieve team goals, establishing integrity and trust with the team and clients while remaining customer focusedServe as primary support liaison between clients and JonasKeep clients informed of progression with issues and provide follow up as necessaryCollaborate with other departments or offices as necessary to expedite resolutionsPromote and maintain a high quality, professional, service-oriented company image among clientsJOB QUALIFICATIONS: Application/customer support experience in the software industry preferredExperience in accounting based applications preferably in Construction and/or related industries a definite assetMust be able to troubleshoot, multi-task in a fast-paced environment and set priorities within time constraintsExcellent organizational, time management, punctuality and customer service skillsCourteous and professional phone manner, demeanor and attitude are essentialGood team player, yet willing to take personal responsibility for resolution of issuesProven ability to meet deadlinesProven ability to problem solve and teach othersExcellent command of the English language (spoken and written)Customer Support AnalystThe Jonas workplace is dynamic, empowering and comprised of motivated self-starters who enjoy the thrill of working in a fast-paced environment. Due to recent growth we are seeking an ambitious person who will learn both our business as well as our clients’ businesses by starting out as a Customer Support Analyst for our Software Support Team in the Construction Division.WHAT MAKES THIS A GREAT PLACE TO WORK?There are many things, but here are the highlights:Competitive compensationOnce established work from home 3-4 days a weekExtensive in-class and hands on trainingComprehensive benefits packageLearning and development opportunitiesCareer development and merit based growth planEnergetic and simulating work environment with annual employee awards and regular department and company events and outingsJob Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayExperience:Finance/Accounting: 1 year (preferred)customer service: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Desc:
JOB PURPOSE:
This is an integral role in supporting UWBC in leading analysis to understand and communicate and develop strategy to maximize impact and philanthropic giving. The position is responsible for developing and preparing effective reporting tools, conducting analysis and developing models and corresponding strategic goals/performance indicators. This position is responsible for leading and/or participating in organizational initiatives related to research, reporting and analytics.
This position is temporary and budgeted till Jan 2023
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Key Responsibilities: Reporting and Analytics
Develops performance reporting tools
Supports and manages dashboards for monitoring key metrics including community impact and financial performance
Conducts comprehensive analysis; highlighting key insights and recommendations
Lead and/or participate in organizational initiatives related to research, reporting and analytics
Key Responsibilities: Strategic Planning and Goal Setting
Develops and implements organizational data models
Leads processes to translate organizational goals into KPIs
Contributes to the development of operation strategies including measurement, tracking, trends analysis, benchmarking and goal setting where applicable
Provides insights and recommendations on donor strategies, fundraising initiatives and impact strategy
Key Responsibilities: Business Process Improvement
Review methodologies, procedures and workflows to identify areas to improve operational efficiency
Provides input into process mapping initiatives, data governance framework and structure
Develops and manages process documentation
General
May participate in community engagement or fundraising activities
Performs other duties related to the qualifications and requirements of the job
QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS:
Education:
Undergraduate degree focusing on Computer Science, Business, Economics, Mathematics or equivalent education/experience
Experience:
Three (3) years' experience as a business, technical, data analyst or related role with experience in researching, organizing, analyzing and presenting data for management use
Skills:
Proficiency in the use of databases, spreadsheets, project management tools at a moderately to highly complex level
Advanced skills in data querying (SQL) and experience with associated BI Tools (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
Experience with digital product development life cycles
Knowledge of scripting or statistical languages (Python, R, etc.) is an asset
Experience with any of the following is an asset, but not required; Advanced data analytics, Machine Learning, Predictive and/or statistical modelling
Ability to use and interpret contact management databases
Skilled in evaluating, developing and implementing processes and procedures to achieve objectives and use data effectively
Ability to manage and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment by adapting and modifying sequence of work, methods, and standards to meet changing conditions
Strong interpersonal skills to contribute to developing a successful team environment
Strategic thinking with well-developed problem-solving skills
Strong written and oral communication to communicate complex data to a variety of audiences
Ability to exercise a high level of tact and discretion in both internal and external interactions is critical
WORKING CONDITIONS:
Some hours outside of business hours to attend meetings and events
CHARACTERISTICS:
For success at UWBC and in this role, certain demonstrable characteristics will be required:
A commitment to building healthy, caring and inclusive communities, internally and externally
Embodying the organization’s core values to be collaborative, compassionate, strategic, responsive, accountable and inspiring
Ability to navigate ambiguity and comfortably operate in it
Drive to succeed as an individual and as a team member
This is a bargaining unit role with CUPE Local 1760. This position is a pay grade 39 which is $38.14/hr. - $44.87/hr.
Interested candidates are invited to apply by submitting a cover letter and resume to job competition C-2022-41.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Desc:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are looking for a qualified and experienced Reporting Analyst. The successful candidate will extract and then interpret data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.
The ideal candidate will have a mix of strong communication, data management and report development skills

A DAY IN THE LIFE
Adept at writing complex SQL queries, report writing and presenting findingsAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsDevelop reports to support internal and external commitmentsGenerating and distributing reports internally and externallyInterpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reportsIdentify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsPresent, discuss and resolve data topics to Clients and attend client meetingsEnsure deadlines are met for all reporting commitmentsDevelop, implement data collection and data analytics best practices that optimize efficiency and qualityMaintain data integrity by creating quality checks and reports to support different processesWork with management to prioritize business and information needsFormulating and communicating meaningful and actionable process plansWorking in partnership with IT and Business Lines to support multiple projectsParticipate in ongoing internal and/or external continuing education activitiesAdhere to Bayshore Policies and ProcedureParticipate in quality activities and continuous improvement initiatives in keeping with the company’s Quality Management SystemParticipates in proactive Health & Safety activities while performing all duties. Is responsible to notify immediate Supervisor of any health and safety risks or concerns. Responsible for completing Accident Reports for all direct reports who injure themselves on the job, within 24 hours of the incident.Maintains confidentiality of client and corporate information and discusses same only with appropriate Bayshore personnel

Education
Bachelor degree in information technology, statistics or data analysis

3+ years experience with SQL, VBA, SSRS and SSISExpert level Excel, MS Access and Dashboarding Skills1 - 3 years experience working with complex data sets3+ years experience in analyzing and presenting results to stakeholders and clientsData mining and in depth knowledge of Data Science techniques is an assentExperience working with pharmaceutical data is an asset
Other Skills and Abilities
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Bayshore is committed to a high quality and safe environment for both our staff and clients/patients. At Bayshore all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two dose vaccine series or one dose of a single- dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the official start date of hire. Medical exemptions or any other kinds of requested exemptions based upon Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Title: Business Analyst (IT)

Title: Data Technical Analyst
Desc:
Position Description:
CGI has an immediate need for Sr Data Technical Analyst / Developer to join our life sciences practice area. This is an exciting full-time opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment supporting one of the largest leaders in the pharmaceutical industry. We take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in an agile environment using emerging technologies.
As an Sr Data Technical Analyst / Developer, you will act as a key participant in data analysis, data development, execution, defect tracking, and reporting. The candidate must have demonstrated experience in data qualtiy development and familiarity with test management, an understanding of best practices, SDLC Scrum and Agile methodologies, as well as strong problem-solving abilities and leadership skills.

Responsibilities Include:
Collaborate with CGI cross-functional teams to analyse, design, and detail the technical aspects and feasibility of proposed solutionsInteracting with the IT and Business Teams by actively participating in requirement/design reviews, providing input on completeness of functional & technical requirements, design elements and schedulesStrong understanding or hands-on experience with data quality, data profiling, data structures, data classification and metadata
Experience in multiple areas of implementations including Data Profiling,data migration, validation, reject processing and pre-landing processingHands-On experience in Informatica, Cognos, and Tibco versions with development skills in ETLHands-On experience working with SQL Oracle databasesCollaborates with the Solution Architect to devise and implement technical solutionsFormulates and defines scope and objectives pertaining to the technical solutionAnalyzes and revises solution or data quality logic based on current environment or technology challenges.
Coordinates with the on-shore/near-shore/off-shore developers for both enhancements and fixing defectsWorks with the Business Analyst to translate business requirements to actionable technical requirementsCoordinates with the Project Manager to schedule releases, set timing expectations, and communicate statusCreates or modifies code to resolve problems considering computer equipment (on-premise or cloud) capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired resultsPrepares technical deliverables and/or provides input to other deliverables related to the IT serviceMonitoring the completion of tasks within time and cost constraints and ensuring that technical and functional objectives are metWorks with the Test Lead to ensure technology and data are relevant for testing in test environments.
Provides on-going technical support for all related IT deliverablesKnowledge or familiarity in software development, Software deployment, Server & hardware installations, platform configuration, DevOps, Agile-Scrum and PM principles would be a nice to haveFamiliarity or knowledge of automation testing environments would be a nice to haveIdentifying areas of improvement across the programGoal oriented with high standards for quality and performance
Required Qualifications:

Exposure and familiarity to SDLC, Agile and Waterfall modelsHands on knowledge and experience with data quality tools like Infomatica, Cognos Tibco, BI & ETL capabilities requiredStrong skills in SQL, OracleFamilarity with process automation tools would be a plusFamilarity in TDD (Test Driven Development) would be a nice plus (not required)Familiarity with various automated testing environments would be a nice to have (not required)Familiarity in test automation, test cases, defecting management tools would be a nice to have.Strong written and verbal communication skillsSelf-starter/Self-directed with the ability to work independently and have critical creative thinking essentialBachelor's degree in Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, or related technology discipline3 - 5+ years IT experience

Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

Title: Credit Risk Business Analyst
Desc:
The Credit Risk Business Analyst is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Excellent communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits. Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Work and performance of all teams in the area are directly affected by the performance of the individual.

Responsibilities:
Gathers operational data from various cross functional stakeholders to examine past business performance
Identifies data patterns & trends, and provides insights to enhance business decision making capability in business planning, process improvement, solution assessment etc.
Recommends actions for future developments & strategic business opportunities, as well as enhancements to operational policies
May be involved in exploratory data analysis, confirmatory data analysis and/or qualitative analysis
Translate data into consumer or customer behavioral insights to drive targeting and segmentation strategies, and communicate clearly and effectively to business partners and senior leaders all findings
Continuously improve processes and strategies by exploring and evaluating new data sources, tools, and capabilities
Work closely with internal and external business partners in building, implementing, tracking and improving decision strategies
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency
Qualifications:
5-8 years of experience
This position requires excellent analytical and business strategy skills
Effective communication skills
Ability to present to business partners and/or leaders to gain approvals
Project and process management skills
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Experience with a prior focus in financial services analytics
Solid organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects at one time
Self-starter who also has a demonstrated ability to work successfully in team environment and drive
Education:
Bachelors/University degree or equivalent experience

Title: Analyst, Quality Assurance (22-12)
Desc:
Saskatoon, SK
Closing Date: April 21, 2022

Canpotex is hiring Analyst, Quality Assurance (22-12) to join our Saskatoon Operations team.
Canpotex is currently undertaking several exciting initiatives focused on people and processes with the recent relocation of our head office within Saskatoon and accompanying a shift to a Hybrid Work Model.

What you will do:
Responsible for the execution of the Product Quality Assurance Program.
Monitor product quality at mine sites, load and discharge ports ensuring product integrity is maintained throughout the supply chain.
Investigate quality concerns and handle customer inquiries related to product quality, product specifications and production processes.
Provide general analytical support for projects, new business opportunities and proposals.
Collect and analyze data to identify deficiencies and problematic areas associated with product quality throughout the supply chain; identifies root causes and suggests improvements.
Cultivate and maintain positive business relationships with mine sites, quality assurance vendors and other businesses and customers stakeholders.
Travels as needed on behalf of Canpotex to various facilities as it relates to product quality investigations and programs.

What you will bring:
Bachelor’s degree or diploma in a natural science, engineering, or related field.
Minimum two to three years’ experience in a relevant role. General office experience or summer positions in a lab/mining environment would be an asset.
Experience in potash production and/or a potash laboratory environment is an asset.
Experience with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Experience with any of the following is considered an asset:
Online quality management systems (EtQ).
Data modelling/extraction software used to process/ analyze large datasets.
Statistical analysis techniques and methods.
Quality assurance/control policies and procedures and industry best practices.
An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

Who you are:
Strong ability in building and maintaining effective working relationships.
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently, prioritize tasks, and provide timely solutions.
Critical thinker who thrives in a fast-paced environment.

Who we are:
Canpotex is one of the world's largest suppliers of potash overseas. On behalf of our Shareholders, Mosaic and Nutrien, we market and deliver Saskatchewan potash, a valuable fertilizer nutrient, to millions of fields and farmers, helping the world grow more food.
We would like to hear from you! Please apply by April 21, 2022.
We thank all candidates for applying; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
To stay connected follow us on LinkedIn.

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Desc:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
What does TD Data & Analytics stand for? For starters, we believe in visionary leadership and insights.
We believe in the talent we grow to better serve our clients, and we know, many of the ground-breaking discoveries and products that represent the future at TD, can all be driven with data.
Job Description
About this Role
With a burgeoning career in data and analytics, this role is a great fit if you're ready to take your growing expertise, key insights, knowledge transfer skills and mentorship to the next level. Day-to day, you'll collect data and information to be developed into analytical interpretation and key action items multi-functional business partners across the organization. You'll produce your own set of insights and action items that will inform business decisions enterprise wide and help to tackle the increasingly complex business problems they face. And as you grow into the role, TD will inspire you to share your knowledge with your peers, empowering them to collaborate and bring TD into the future of banking.
As a Business Insights Analyst, you will:
Apply understanding of respective business strategies to produce relevant data analysis to support business goals and objectives
Develop analysis to illustrate business trends and identify areas of business opportunities
Produce insights and recommend business actions to support business strategy and/or tackle business problems
Work in partnership with various functions to provide day-to-day support and delivery of analytics
Provide top-tier specialized knowledge, advice and/or mentorship to various partners and team members
Execute on data requests accurately and within a timely manner
Represent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource
Act as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain
Provides day-to-day support and delivery of analytics
Contribute to the identification of key performance indicators
Experienced professional role providing specialized guidance/assistance to function supported
Focus on short to medium-term non-routine specialized/less complex issues and/or raised matters of concern
Independently perform activities end to end
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD?
Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Three (3) or more years relevant experience
Additional Information
NOTE: A candidate has been pre-identified for this opportunity.
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Analyst
Desc:
Our bottom line is different.
There’s something special about working at ATB, and it’s been recognized on every top employer list that matters. Maybe it’s our exceptional culture where your total wellness is supported through market-leading benefits and you’re free to bring your whole self to work. Maybe it’s our commitment to a growth mindset and our unrelenting thirst for making it possible for fellow Albertans—even the ones who aren’t our clients.
Whatever it is, you won’t find a more genuine, driven and knowledgeable group of humans anywhere. We foster a culture of purpose, performance and possibilities. We engage with intense curiosity, and bring our whole selves to work, every day. We know it starts with people like you, so take a chance and start with us.
Job Number: REQ3763
Location: Alberta Remote - Calgary Preferred
Apply by: April 20th, 2022
Paygrade: Under Review
# Positions available: 1
Leader Name: Data Scientist Lead, Customer Intelligence Analytics
As ATB’s next Data Analyst, you are an integral member of the team supporting customer listening and customer obsession objectives. The Data Analyst applies their skills to acquiring and analyzing customer listening feedback data along with various other operational and experiential data. The Data Analyst brings an insatiable curiosity of customers, data, and behaviour with the desire to help expand knowledge and understanding of customers.
Data Analyst Accountabilities:
Ability to translate complex data into smart, simple and focused insights.
Effective storytelling skills; presentation of information and ideas in a user-friendly and comprehensive format.
Solid knowledge and expertise in business intelligence, analysis concepts, techniques and methods including predictive and cognitive analytics.
You conduct analysis from multiple large data sources and merge together experiential data along with customer data to gather a holistic customer picture.
Collaborate effectively with a variety of stakeholders: customer-facing employees, business managers, data analysts and information architects.
You provide monthly / quarterly analysis of feedback results utilizing enterprise platforms such as Tableau.
Leverage BI tools with data insights for executive viewing and self serve opportunities for enterprise access.
Requirements
As the ideal candidate you possess:
Must have SQL experience/knowledge and preference will be given to candidates with Tableau experience/knowledge.
1 to 3 years of experience.
You have experience using data transformation and manipulation (e.g., SQL, SAS, R, Python).
Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, physics, mathematics, economics or a related field.
You’ve worked with different types of data infrastructures (e.g., data warehouses or data lakes).
You have experience applying business logic and statistical techniques to data in order to develop and communicate customer insights from various data sources.
You have some experience in cloud computing (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure, etc..) and are curious to keep learning and improving your skills in this area.
Benefits
Be great. Be you. Believe.
We are dedicated to building a workforce reflective of the diversity within our communities and creating an environment where every team member has what they need to reach their potential. We encourage candidates from all equity-seeking groups to apply.
What happens next?
Thank you for applying online. If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting close date regarding next steps. We might ask you to participate in a digital interview or phone interview. If you require any accommodations, please let us know.
All ATB Financial team members are required to disclose their vaccination status and provide proof of vaccination as a condition of employment to help support client and team member safety.
Stay in touch!
ATB is excited to know you’re interested in a career with us! Follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram to get the inside scoop on what our team is up to.

Title: Marketing Science Analyst
Desc:
Marketing Science Analyst

As a Marketing Science Analyst, your curiosity never ends. The next question is always on your mind, helping you to understand how marketing science fits in the big picture of a project. You bring in 1 to 3 years of experience, owning marketing science deliverables across a broad range of initiatives, and focusing on at least two of the following areas: tracking and measurement, implementation, reporting, data visualization, testing and evaluation, data integration, or statistical modeling. You understand the nature and purpose of the main Digital marketing channels, enjoy collaborating with others, and are able to communicate clearly and effectively.

You will:

Analyze data for insights and identify methods to improve processes.
Design, build and automate analyses, reports, dashboards and other deliverables.
Assist in the ideation, development and execution of measurement strategies and frameworks.
Gather data through various third-party platforms and ensure compliance with data governance protocols.
Communicate complex analysis in an effective, easy-to-understand manner
Implementation:
Define, implement and validate tracking tags/codes across multiple digital platforms.
Statistical Analysis:
Assist in the ideation, development and analysis of A/B and multivariate testing.

You have:

B.S. degree in a quantitative or technical field. Including but not limited to: economics, mathematics, business, finance, social sciences, computer science, or information management. M.S. degree preferred.
Advanced Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office skills, with top notch communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with one or more digital advertising/analytics platforms: CM360, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google Analytics etc.
Experience with one or more visualization platforms (e.g.: Tableau, Domo, PowerBI, etc.).
Ability to efficiently communicate deliveries and delays of project with follow-ups as needed.
A drive to keep learning and offer your team support to grow and learn.
Data engineering/architecture:
Proficiency in Python, R, SQL, or other business-relevant statistical and database programming language.
Media/Marketing:
Reporting or analytics experience with at least 2 media platforms (e.g.: Google Campaign Manager, Google Ads, Facebook Insights, Search Ads 360, etc.).
An understanding of the media landscape.
An understanding of Customer Relationship Management (CRM), and how its activities are planned and executed.
An understanding of Market Research, its principles, and how it is planned and executed.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Desc:
Job Type: Permanent
Reference code: 102121
Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
Our Purpose
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Our Database Marketing and Insights team provides marketers with world-class prospect and customer data integration services that dramatically improve their prospecting and / or customer care strategies.
What will your typical day look like?
In an entrepreneurial environment, the successful candidate will be involved in the development, production support and enhancements of a complex multi-layer software application and processes within the Database Marketing and Insights team.
The role of the Sr. Data Analyst is pivotal to the success of our data production support and product development model. The role involves a mixture of well-defined production execution steps and development/coordination of data management tasks. The incumbent will be the interface between the business management leads, quality control specialists and analytical analysts within our team, and the larger project teams.
Responsibilities
Design, develop and document automated and standardized processes for clients and internal applications
Execute ongoing daily production jobs and client requests, on time and with high quality
Respond to client-related inquiries and issues within a defined time frame
Create ad-hoc reports and/or data extracts for custom client requests
Perform various production validation procedures to ensure business requirements are met and generate reports that will be verified by a Quality Control Analyst.
Work with the Quality Control Team to establish objectives and implement processes to support quality control standards through the Stage Gate methodology
Monitor, maintain and execute periodic updates to Client data repositories
Implement production fixes or upgrades as required to support the existing process
Propose new enhancements to the existing production process through new or modified usage of existing programs
Remove corrupted data and fixing coding errors and related problems as required
Perform analysis to assess quality and meaning of data; identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets
Filter data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to identify and correct code problems
Using statistical tools that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Scrutinize data to recognize and identify patterns when required

About the team
DM&I has in-house data specialists who serve data management needs for organizations across all industries including financial institutions, retail, life sciences and healthcare, B2B, education, government and automotive.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you

Skills and Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Applied Science/Applied Mathematics/Computer Science/Business Information Systems, or relevant degrees with a strong focus on math or data
Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as a Data Analyst, or any combination of experience and education that would provide the required knowledge and abilities for successful performance
Solid understanding of database technologies including Microsoft SQL Server
Previous experience and knowledge of programming languages like SQL, BASE SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide
Experience with statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analysis
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation
Demonstrated initiative, excellent problem-solving skills and strong attention to details
Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage competing project priorities
Collaborative and strong team-working skills
Strong capability to understand relevant business parameters along with an ability to select appropriate processes or procedures from multiple options
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in Windows and Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint)
Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik, Power BI
Our shared values
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.

Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.

Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.

Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.

Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.
The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now
At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Title: Data Analyst
Desc:
Employer:
House of Friendship
Type:
Full-Time
Term (Duration):
Contract
Description:
House of Friendship - Data Analyst


At House of Friendship we believe in what we are doing. We get out of bed each day to make a difference in our community; to walk with and to serve. We are not happy with the status quo. We get energy from ongoing learning and growth. We lead with passion and believe without a doubt that everyone deserves to belong and thrive. We live and breathe our values of Compassion, Inclusion, Justice, Dignity and Hope. And we have fun!


Sounds pretty great doesn't it? It is!


We are seeking an upbeat, organized and self-initiated individual to fulfill a significant administrative role within our Addiction Services and Housing areas. You will be the administrator of the electronic health record and oversee the data entry expectations/targets, process and analyze data and prepare reports for both internal and external purposes. This position also participates/develops staff training, conducts audits and oversees the dashboard and quarterly reporting requirements.


** This is a full-time, contract position from April 2022 to September 2022.

Scheduled Monday to Friday. Flexibility to work remote and in office. **


Your key responsibilities include:

Data collection, analysis, reporting
Target setting, dashboard, balanced score card
Graphs, visuals of data/statistics
Training/building capacity for data entry and data integrity
Liaise as needed with Telus Health (EHR)
Work with partners to collect required data through MOU's and data sharing agreements
Work directly with the management team in Addictions and Housing

Your skills and experience include:

University degree or college diploma in related field
A minimum of 3 years work experience in data management
Superior organizational skills with strong attention to detail
Knowledge and experience in Health care reporting including Catalyst, DATIS, OHRS, Telus PS suites
Experience with and strong skills in, internet based data systems including report generation and data analysis
Strong skills in Excel, Microsoft Office Suite
Internally motivated with the ability to work comfortably and effectively independently
Knowledge of issues relating to and impacting individuals and a strength based philosophy is necessary
Commitment to understand and uphold the mission and values of House of Friendship is expected
Exemplary emotional intelligence, resilience, communication, conflict management and problem solving skills required
Ability to work professionally as a team member with staff, participants and community members
Understanding of diverse populations including people from various cultural backgrounds, income levels, and sensitivity to their needs
Experience with and commitment to using an anti-racism, anti-oppressive and trauma informed approach to consultation, program design, evaluations of processes and service delivery
Must be dependable, professional, flexible, a team player, and have a positive attitude
Respectful, supportive and engaging approach to persons with physical and/or cognitive disabilities, addictions, mental illness and other life challenges
Excellent project, timeline and deadline management skills including skills in logistics, planning and detailed record keeping

Rate of Pay:

At House of Friendship all compensation ranges are categorized under a series of "grades" and we base our payment structure on internal equity. When determining rate of pay, a candidate's past related experience will be taken into consideration along with where others with similar experience are currently on the pay grid.

Note: Most new team members will start somewhere between the start rate and the mid point of the range.


Grade: 4

Min: $21.10

Mid: $24.44

Max: $27.77


Working Conditions:

37.5 hours per week, generally daytime, weekday hours
Work may be performed in a home office for some of the weekly hours
Encountering participants at program sites who may be under the influence alcohol and other drugs and/or experiencing symptoms of mental illness can be expected

COVID-19 Vaccination Policy:

To maintain the safety of staff and participants, House of Friendship has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. All Staff hired after October 19, 2021 are required to provide proof of being Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19 as a pre-condition of their employment or placement offer. If an individual is unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19, they will be required to submit written proof verifying a medical reason or by submitting a request under the Ontario Human Rights Code and agree to regular Rapid Antigen Testing at least two times per week. When documentation has been received and approved, House of Friendship will provide accommodation up to the point of undue hardship in compliance with the OHRC and may follow up to receive further information and/or documentation as required. Failure to meet these requirements will result in the immediate revocation of an offer of employment.


If you are as passionate as we are about serving the community, let's talk.

Wed, Apr 6 2022

$21.10 - 27.22/hour

https://house-of-friendship.hirehive.com/job/96069/data-analyst

Title: HR Systems Analyst
Desc:
Role impact:
The HR Systems Analyst will be a key player in the design, development, implementation, testing, maintenance and enhancements of all Human Resources related technology. This position will provide functional and technical expertise in analyzing, designing and implementing HR system solutions in support of organizational and business requirements, as well as utilizing technology to improve efficiencies. The HR Systems Analyst will also monitor data quality and integrity and proactively lead data remediation efforts.


What you will deliver: 

Maintain and identify the accuracy and data integrity of the Human Resource Information System by running array of reports and conducting regular audits. Communicate and collaborate with respective HR team members to resolve any data discrepancies
Serve as a technical point of contact within HR and assist subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities
Collaborate with HR colleagues, IT and external vendors to ensure user requirement and change requests are reviewed and approved
Assists Senior Manager, Compensation & Systems with the implementation of work processes and system solutions that support business initiatives, enhance the value and integrity of data and create an efficient system environment for users
Contribute to the design and implementation of new and additional functionality to the HRIS, including Manager Self Service (MSS), Employee Self Service (ESS) and all other required modules
Works with HR functional areas to interpret business requirements and develop systems configuration solutions
Administrate the HRIS system, with an ongoing focus on identifying opportunities for continuous improvement through technology
Develop reports and dashboards, including alerts and bursts
Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including all HR applications
Develop and optimizes system reporting and prepares ad hoc reports based on end user requirements and specifications
Creates and maintains appropriate documentation and user training in support of HR Systems applications
Ensure IT General Controls are adhered to for access, changes and incidents
Responsible for training Property Administrators and Managers/Supervisors on the requirements of Time and Attendance (UTA). This involves hands-on instruction, on-going telephone support to ensure all properties are familiar with and adhere to the prescribed procedures and guidelines for processing the biweekly payroll
Support technical aspect and data collection for annual employee survey through Qualtrics including pulse surveys conducted throughout the year
Prepare the annual department budget and monthly variance analysis preparation. Monitor expenses to verify invoices are coded to the correct accounts. Responsible for any budget questions and communications; key contact person for Finance
Participates in special projects as required


 
What your strengths are: 

Strong communication skills, both oral and written
Knowledge of HR administrative practices and legislative policies
Strong analytical skills, including an ability to track, analyze and interpret numbers and data
Make recommendations based on data extrapolation in a clear and logical manner 
Proven ability to develop and manage complex reporting, understand statistical information and make recommendations based on thorough analysis of the data
Highly organized with the ability to cope with multiple demands in a fast-paced environment
Team player; also able to work autonomously
Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines


 
What you need to succeed: 

Minimum of 3 years’ experience working with HR systems or equivalence
Post-secondary education in Business and/or Human Resources diploma
Advanced capability with software and application tools including MS Office Excel and Word
Knowledge of automated systems such HRIS, payroll systems and time and attendance, preferably with UKG Pro. 
Working knowledge of BI reporting. 


Why you should join us: 

    At Cadillac Fairview we have been transforming communities for over 50 years. We are so much more than our properties. We are building leaders at all levels. We offer the challenge of interesting work, a great organizational culture, the opportunity to collaborate with the best in the business, and support for your growth and development. We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension. Imagine a place where you can make a difference!
    



    At CF our everyday actions and critical business decisions are guided by our CF Values. Achieving results is naturally important for us and we achieve results through behaviours that are consistent with our CF Values.
    



Are you someone who believes in our values?




Aim Higher – we strive to exceed expectations 
Own Your Expertise – we empower ourselves and each other 
Collaborate Effectively – we bring the right people together to get the right results 
Engage with Empathy – we objectively consider the needs of others 
Embrace Change – we drive, learn from, and adapt to change 



    At CF you’ll join a diverse community and award-winning team where your talent and commitment to excellence are welcomed, valued and respected. 
    We’re ready to meet you there – are you?




CF is
 an equal opportunity employer
 and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. If you need reasonable accommodation during the recruitment, assessment, and/or selection process, please notify your CF contact or email cfcareers@cadillacfairview.com.



CF currently has a vaccination policy that is a condition of employment.

Title: Senior Data & Reporting Analyst
Desc:
Info-Tech is one of the world’s fastest-growing IT research and advisory companies, proudly serving over 30,000 IT professionals. We are looking for a strong Senior Data and Reporting Analyst to join our Sales Operations team.
Why join us?
We are a growth focused, entrepreneurially spirited company that has consistently achieved YoY growth in our 23 years of operation and are especially proud of our double-digit growth in the midst of a global pandemic.
When you join Info-Tech you get access to unlimited opportunities for professional growth and development in your field of expertise or areas you are interested in. We promote learning to help you be a better professional and we will also pay for some of those certifications.
You will work in a highly collaborative team that functions efficiently even in a remote work setting. You will have flexibility to work from home, at the office (located in London / Toronto Ontario and quite fun), or in a hybrid mode.
We offer great competitive salaries, benefits plan, and RRSP matching plans.
Responsibilities:
Subject matter expertise on data projects
Identify, define, implement, and ensure adherence to technical strategy, policies, and standards
 Participate in evaluation and selection of software systems (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
Work with vendors to assess products, understand features, and assist in maximizing ROI
Establishing Audit Guidelines According to Organizational Standards.
Expert understand how to get the accurate data when given requirements (proper fields, exception and business rules) and be able to mentor juniors on their understanding
Define best practices for ETL tools and integration points to blend multiple data sets together
Gather Data requirements from customers and develop solutions to meet those requirements
Development of Dashboards and reporting for all departments
Define Procedures for Resolving Issues Found During Audits
Lead the evaluation and selection of software systems (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
Work with vendors to assess products, understand features, and assist in maximizing ROI
Define Required Audit Reports for Communicating Status of Systems and Issues Found
Understand industry trends, emerging technologies, and how they apply to the organization
Work with the Statistical and data governance groups as needed.
Education
 Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Engineering, Computer Science, IT, Mathematics
Knowledge and Experience:
A minimum of 8+ years overall IT industry experience
Experience presenting ideas, products, concept papers to varied audiences
Leadership capabilities and proven ability to manage difficult stakeholders
Experience with configuration management and automation tools
Experience with Software development full lifecycle methodologies, patterns, frameworks, libraries, and tools
Knowledge of one or more programming and scripting languages
Experience with relational, graph and/or unstructured data technologies such as SQL Server, Azure SQL
Experience in data movement and transformation technologies
 Working knowledge of visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
 Salesforce experience is a bonus
Info-Tech Research Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and does not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected status or characteristic including Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants. To that end, upon request, ITRG will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.

Title: Business Analyst in Global Clinical Supply Chain Planning
Desc:
Role: Business Analyst in Global Clinical Supply Chain Planning
Department: PTSD
Type: FTE
The Clinical Demand & Supply Planning organization’s mission is to cost-effectively ensure the right product is in the right place at the right time every time, such that no patient will go without treatment and no clinical trial will be delayed.
The Clinical Supply Chain Business Analyst is an expert in related reporting and analytics solutions. This role is essential to increase the maturity in Roche clinical supply chain planning, allowing planners to access critical information more easily, with less individual effort, and at higher consistency, leading to better decisions and outcomes.

For this, the role will build and own an integrated roadmap for reporting and analytics capabilities within the Clinical SC Planning domain. He/she will own the planning, design and implementation of improvements, and for this will collaborate strongly with business functions (super users, SMEs), Business Capability Owners & IRT specialists in the Systems & Process Optimization (S&PO) chapter, Informatics, Aspire and the wider PT Analytics and Reporting groups. He/She will foster an environment of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing, to socialize new capabilities and build a stronger base for reporting and analytics.
Over time, the Supply Chain Business analyst will be expected to mature the analytics capabilities in the organization from reporting into advanced analytics in order to support higher value and more complex decisions such as supply chain optimization.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and own a roadmap for Reporting and Analytics capabilities in PTDS-PLAN with the aim to:
Prioritize reports will that be needed in the future to support the new processes introduced with the upcoming organization transformations and ASPIRE (Roche’s global ERP program)
Identify the future platforms to run those reports, including leveraging existing infrastructure and functionality
Clarify roles and responsibilities for report generation
Develop and present business cases for further investments in reporting & analytics
Provision of standard as well as ad hoc reports and system extracts to the planning teams as required.
Develop new reporting capabilities as outlined on the roadmap, e.g. in the area of Lead time, order size and rounding value optimization, Segmentation and supply chain operating model analysis.
Develop and maintain strong understanding of the Roche global OMP solution, supply chain planning business processes and data structures, stay closely connected to the planning community.
Build and maintain a Community of Practise (CoP, or “Pod”) in PTDS-PLAN to share best-practices, news, improvement ideas, and knowledge about Reporting capabilities.
Contribute or lead projects impacting Supply Chain planning such as Network changes and analysis, Optimization requests, SAP Projects, update of inventory policies.
Challenges status quo and targets break-through innovations. Benchmarks internally and externally and brings best practices to Roche.
Competencies & Experience
Strong motivation to enhance Roche’s supply chain planning capabilities through leveraging data as an asset.
Strong knowledge of clinical supply chain planning and reporting processes & IT systems
Knowledge of IRT functionalities for clinical trials (understanding of clinical trial protocol translation into supply chain parameters managed by IRT systems)
Strong analytical, logic and problem solving skills
Proven continuous improvement mindset
Experience in systems and data modelling, and programming scripting language (Python, R, OPAL, Javascript or anything similar)
Able to effectively communicate technical concepts to the planning community, capable of translating business requirements into technical concepts
Passion for collaboration and customer service mentality
Superior problem solving skills with an ability to anticipate issues and recommend solutions
Can-do (differently) attitude and get it done
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills (English mandatory)
Experience in project management, in a cross-functional and cross-cultural environment and willingness to work in a global organization
Experience & Education
Strong Experience in managing/using enterprise reporting applications (e.g BW, Tableau, etc)
Know-how of ERP systems, preferably OMP, SAP APO and SAP ERP
Experience in Supply chain planning is a plus
Degree in engineering, mathematics, informatics
APICS and/or SCOR certification, or associated relevant experience are a plus
Who we are
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.
As of January 4, 2022, Roche requires all new employees who work in Canada to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date they take office. This requirement is a condition of employment at Roche that applies regardless of whether the position is on a Roche campus or remotely. If you have a valid reason for not being fully immunized, which is limited to certain specific medical reasons or other valid reasons protected by applicable human rights laws, you may request an exemption and / or adaptation measures regarding this vaccination requirement.
Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Job Level:
Individual contributor

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Desc:
Overview:

It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.
Summary:
Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst is a skilled analytical professional who has significant hands-on experience with analysis and reporting as they relate to the merchandise productivity in a large organization. As an Analyst, you will be responsible to create and develop metrics, see opportunities in the business and help shape the vision for reporting and analysis at OSL.
 Responsibilities:
Work with the Business Intelligence Manager to determine the vision for reporting and builds a plan to execute on those goals
Work within a team to prioritize work and achieve team goals on time
Support the team with producing reports as required, scheduled or ad hoc
Assist in identifying opportunities in the business and works to produce impactful analysis
Examine reports and produce accurate data
Assist with the compilation and distribution of key financial and management reports
Liaise with internal and external clients on reporting needs to find effective solutions
Assist with new project opportunities to identify reporting and data system requirements
Candidate Qualifications:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset
What we offer:
Competitive base salary plus bonuses and other perks
Vacation plus additional flex days
Comprehensive benefits
Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
A supportive workplace culture and work environment
Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

 At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.

 Enough about us, let’s talk about you
