 Bachelor’s degree in Applied Science/Applied Mathematics/Computer Science/Business Information Systems, or relevant degrees with a strong focus on math or data Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as a Data Analyst, or any combination of experience and education that would provide the required knowledge and abilities for successful performance Solid understanding of database technologies including Microsoft SQL Server Previous experience and knowledge of programming languages like SQL, BASE SAS, SAS Enterprise Guide Experience with statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analysis Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation Demonstrated initiative, excellent problem-solving skills and strong attention to details Adept at queries, writing reports, and making presentations Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage competing project priorities Collaborative and strong team-working skills Strong capability to understand relevant business parameters along with an ability to select appropriate processes or procedures from multiple options Excellent verbal and written communication skills Proficiency in Windows and Office (Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint) Knowledge of data visualization software like Tableau, Qlik, Power BI

 Our shared values
 While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
 They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
 Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:

 Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world. 
 Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility. 
 Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being. 
 Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions. 
 Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.

 The next step is yours
 Sound like The One Firm. For You? Apply Now
 At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
 We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
 By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally. Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Title: Data Analyst
Desc:
Employer:
House of Friendship
Type:
Full-Time
Term (Duration):
Contract
Description:
House of Friendship - Data Analyst


At House of Friendship we believe in what we are doing. We get out of bed each day to make a difference in our community; to walk with and to serve. We are not happy with the status quo. We get energy from ongoing learning and growth. We lead with passion and believe without a doubt that everyone deserves to belong and thrive. We live and breathe our values of Compassion, Inclusion, Justice, Dignity and Hope. And we have fun!


Sounds pretty great doesn't it? It is!


We are seeking an upbeat, organized and self-initiated individual to fulfill a significant administrative role within our Addiction Services and Housing areas. You will be the administrator of the electronic health record and oversee the data entry expectations/targets, process and analyze data and prepare reports for both internal and external purposes. This position also participates/develops staff training, conducts audits and oversees the dashboard and quarterly reporting requirements.


** This is a full-time, contract position from April 2022 to September 2022.

Scheduled Monday to Friday. Flexibility to work remote and in office. **


Your key responsibilities include:

Data collection, analysis, reporting
Target setting, dashboard, balanced score card
Graphs, visuals of data/statistics
Training/building capacity for data entry and data integrity
Liaise as needed with Telus Health (EHR)
Work with partners to collect required data through MOU's and data sharing agreements
Work directly with the management team in Addictions and Housing

Your skills and experience include:

University degree or college diploma in related field
A minimum of 3 years work experience in data management
Superior organizational skills with strong attention to detail
Knowledge and experience in Health care reporting including Catalyst, DATIS, OHRS, Telus PS suites
Experience with and strong skills in, internet based data systems including report generation and data analysis
Strong skills in Excel, Microsoft Office Suite
Internally motivated with the ability to work comfortably and effectively independently
Knowledge of issues relating to and impacting individuals and a strength based philosophy is necessary
Commitment to understand and uphold the mission and values of House of Friendship is expected
Exemplary emotional intelligence, resilience, communication, conflict management and problem solving skills required
Ability to work professionally as a team member with staff, participants and community members
Understanding of diverse populations including people from various cultural backgrounds, income levels, and sensitivity to their needs
Experience with and commitment to using an anti-racism, anti-oppressive and trauma informed approach to consultation, program design, evaluations of processes and service delivery
Must be dependable, professional, flexible, a team player, and have a positive attitude
Respectful, supportive and engaging approach to persons with physical and/or cognitive disabilities, addictions, mental illness and other life challenges
Excellent project, timeline and deadline management skills including skills in logistics, planning and detailed record keeping

Rate of Pay:

At House of Friendship all compensation ranges are categorized under a series of "grades" and we base our payment structure on internal equity. When determining rate of pay, a candidate's past related experience will be taken into consideration along with where others with similar experience are currently on the pay grid.

Note: Most new team members will start somewhere between the start rate and the mid point of the range.


Grade: 4

Min: $21.10

Mid: $24.44

Max: $27.77


Working Conditions:

37.5 hours per week, generally daytime, weekday hours
Work may be performed in a home office for some of the weekly hours
Encountering participants at program sites who may be under the influence alcohol and other drugs and/or experiencing symptoms of mental illness can be expected

COVID-19 Vaccination Policy:

To maintain the safety of staff and participants, House of Friendship has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. All Staff hired after October 19, 2021 are required to provide proof of being Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19 as a pre-condition of their employment or placement offer. If an individual is unable to be vaccinated against COVID-19, they will be required to submit written proof verifying a medical reason or by submitting a request under the Ontario Human Rights Code and agree to regular Rapid Antigen Testing at least two times per week. When documentation has been received and approved, House of Friendship will provide accommodation up to the point of undue hardship in compliance with the OHRC and may follow up to receive further information and/or documentation as required. Failure to meet these requirements will result in the immediate revocation of an offer of employment.

Title: HR Systems Analyst
Desc:
Role impact:
The HR Systems Analyst will be a key player in the design, development, implementation, testing, maintenance and enhancements of all Human Resources related technology. This position will provide functional and technical expertise in analyzing, designing and implementing HR system solutions in support of organizational and business requirements, as well as utilizing technology to improve efficiencies. The HR Systems Analyst will also monitor data quality and integrity and proactively lead data remediation efforts.

What you will deliver:
Maintain and identify the accuracy and data integrity of the Human Resource Information System by running array of reports and conducting regular audits. Communicate and collaborate with respective HR team members to resolve any data discrepancies
Serve as a technical point of contact within HR and assist subject matter experts with ensuring data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities
Collaborate with HR colleagues, IT and external vendors to ensure user requirement and change requests are reviewed and approved
Assists Senior Manager, Compensation & Systems with the implementation of work processes and system solutions that support business initiatives, enhance the value and integrity of data and create an efficient system environment for users
Contribute to the design and implementation of new and additional functionality to the HRIS, including Manager Self Service (MSS), Employee Self Service (ESS) and all other required modules
Works with HR functional areas to interpret business requirements and develop systems configuration solutions
Administrate the HRIS system, with an ongoing focus on identifying opportunities for continuous improvement through technology
Develop reports and dashboards, including alerts and bursts
Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including all HR applications
Develop and optimizes system reporting and prepares ad hoc reports based on end user requirements and specifications
Creates and maintains appropriate documentation and user training in support of HR Systems applications
Ensure IT General Controls are adhered to for access, changes and incidents
Responsible for training Property Administrators and Managers/Supervisors on the requirements of Time and Attendance (UTA). This involves hands-on instruction, on-going telephone support to ensure all properties are familiar with and adhere to the prescribed procedures and guidelines for processing the biweekly payroll
Support technical aspect and data collection for annual employee survey through Qualtrics including pulse surveys conducted throughout the year
Prepare the annual department budget and monthly variance analysis preparation. Monitor expenses to verify invoices are coded to the correct accounts. Responsible for any budget questions and communications; key contact person for Finance
Participates in special projects as required

What your strengths are:
Strong communication skills, both oral and written
Knowledge of HR administrative practices and legislative policies
Strong analytical skills, including an ability to track, analyze and interpret numbers and data
Make recommendations based on data extrapolation in a clear and logical manner
Proven ability to develop and manage complex reporting, understand statistical information and make recommendations based on thorough analysis of the data
Highly organized with the ability to cope with multiple demands in a fast-paced environment
Team player; also able to work autonomously
Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines

What you need to succeed:
Minimum of 3 years’ experience working with HR systems or equivalence
Post-secondary education in Business and/or Human Resources diploma
Advanced capability with software and application tools including MS Office Excel and Word
Knowledge of automated systems such HRIS, payroll systems and time and attendance, preferably with UKG Pro.
Working knowledge of BI reporting.
Why you should join us:
At Cadillac Fairview we have been transforming communities for over 50 years. We are so much more than our properties. We are building leaders at all levels. We offer the challenge of interesting work, a great organizational culture, the opportunity to collaborate with the best in the business, and support for your growth and development. We reward values-based behavior and superior results with a competitive rewards package that includes best-in-class benefits and pension. Imagine a place where you can make a difference!
At CF our everyday actions and critical business decisions are guided by our CF Values. Achieving results is naturally important for us and we achieve results through behaviours that are consistent with our CF Values.
Are you someone who believes in our values?
Aim Higher – we strive to exceed expectations
Own Your Expertise – we empower ourselves and each other
Collaborate Effectively – we bring the right people together to get the right results
Engage with Empathy – we objectively consider the needs of others
Embrace Change – we drive, learn from, and adapt to change
At CF you’ll join a diverse community and award-winning team where your talent and commitment to excellence are welcomed, valued and respected. We’re ready to meet you there – are you?
CF is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. If you need reasonable accommodation during the recruitment, assessment, and/or selection process, please notify your CF contact or email cfcareers@cadillacfairview.com.
CF currently has a vaccination policy that is a condition of employment.

Title: Senior Data & Reporting Analyst
Desc:
Info-Tech is one of the world’s fastest-growing IT research and advisory companies, proudly serving over 30,000 IT professionals. We are looking for a strong Senior Data and Reporting Analyst to join our Sales Operations team.
Why join us?
We are a growth focused, entrepreneurially spirited company that has consistently achieved YoY growth in our 23 years of operation and are especially proud of our double-digit growth in the midst of a global pandemic.
When you join Info-Tech you get access to unlimited opportunities for professional growth and development in your field of expertise or areas you are interested in. We promote learning to help you be a better professional and we will also pay for some of those certifications.
You will work in a highly collaborative team that functions efficiently even in a remote work setting. You will have flexibility to work from home, at the office (located in London / Toronto Ontario and quite fun), or in a hybrid mode.
We offer great competitive salaries, benefits plan, and RRSP matching plans.
Responsibilities:
Subject matter expertise on data projects
Identify, define, implement, and ensure adherence to technical strategy, policies, and standards
 Participate in evaluation and selection of software systems (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
Work with vendors to assess products, understand features, and assist in maximizing ROI
Establishing Audit Guidelines According to Organizational Standards.
Expert understand how to get the accurate data when given requirements (proper fields, exception and business rules) and be able to mentor juniors on their understanding
Define best practices for ETL tools and integration points to blend multiple data sets together
Gather Data requirements from customers and develop solutions to meet those requirements
Development of Dashboards and reporting for all departments
Define Procedures for Resolving Issues Found During Audits
Lead the evaluation and selection of software systems (Tableau, Power BI, etc)
Work with vendors to assess products, understand features, and assist in maximizing ROI
Define Required Audit Reports for Communicating Status of Systems and Issues Found
Understand industry trends, emerging technologies, and how they apply to the organization
Work with the Statistical and data governance groups as needed.
Education
 Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Engineering, Computer Science, IT, Mathematics
Knowledge and Experience:
A minimum of 8+ years overall IT industry experience
Experience presenting ideas, products, concept papers to varied audiences
Leadership capabilities and proven ability to manage difficult stakeholders
Experience with configuration management and automation tools
Experience with Software development full lifecycle methodologies, patterns, frameworks, libraries, and tools
Knowledge of one or more programming and scripting languages
Experience with relational, graph and/or unstructured data technologies such as SQL Server, Azure SQL
Experience in data movement and transformation technologies
 Working knowledge of visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
 Salesforce experience is a bonus
Info-Tech Research Group of companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion and does not discriminate on the basis of any legally protected status or characteristic including Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran and are pleased to consider all qualified applicants. To that end, upon request, ITRG will ensure, to the extent possible, that accommodation be made available to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.

Title: Business Analyst in Global Clinical Supply Chain Planning
Desc:
Role: Business Analyst in Global Clinical Supply Chain Planning
Department: PTSD
Type: FTE
The Clinical Demand & Supply Planning organization’s mission is to cost-effectively ensure the right product is in the right place at the right time every time, such that no patient will go without treatment and no clinical trial will be delayed.
The Clinical Supply Chain Business Analyst is an expert in related reporting and analytics solutions. This role is essential to increase the maturity in Roche clinical supply chain planning, allowing planners to access critical information more easily, with less individual effort, and at higher consistency, leading to better decisions and outcomes.

For this, the role will build and own an integrated roadmap for reporting and analytics capabilities within the Clinical SC Planning domain. He/she will own the planning, design and implementation of improvements, and for this will collaborate strongly with business functions (super users, SMEs), Business Capability Owners & IRT specialists in the Systems & Process Optimization (S&PO) chapter, Informatics, Aspire and the wider PT Analytics and Reporting groups. He/She will foster an environment of continuous improvement and knowledge sharing, to socialize new capabilities and build a stronger base for reporting and analytics.
Over time, the Supply Chain Business analyst will be expected to mature the analytics capabilities in the organization from reporting into advanced analytics in order to support higher value and more complex decisions such as supply chain optimization.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and own a roadmap for Reporting and Analytics capabilities in PTDS-PLAN with the aim to:
Prioritize reports will that be needed in the future to support the new processes introduced with the upcoming organization transformations and ASPIRE (Roche’s global ERP program)
Identify the future platforms to run those reports, including leveraging existing infrastructure and functionality
Clarify roles and responsibilities for report generation
Develop and present business cases for further investments in reporting & analytics
Provision of standard as well as ad hoc reports and system extracts to the planning teams as required.
Develop new reporting capabilities as outlined on the roadmap, e.g. in the area of Lead time, order size and rounding value optimization, Segmentation and supply chain operating model analysis.
Develop and maintain strong understanding of the Roche global OMP solution, supply chain planning business processes and data structures, stay closely connected to the planning community.
Build and maintain a Community of Practise (CoP, or “Pod”) in PTDS-PLAN to share best-practices, news, improvement ideas, and knowledge about Reporting capabilities.
Contribute or lead projects impacting Supply Chain planning such as Network changes and analysis, Optimization requests, SAP Projects, update of inventory policies.
Challenges status quo and targets break-through innovations. Benchmarks internally and externally and brings best practices to Roche.
Competencies & Experience
Strong motivation to enhance Roche’s supply chain planning capabilities through leveraging data as an asset.
Strong knowledge of clinical supply chain planning and reporting processes & IT systems
Knowledge of IRT functionalities for clinical trials (understanding of clinical trial protocol translation into supply chain parameters managed by IRT systems)
Strong analytical, logic and problem solving skills
Proven continuous improvement mindset
Experience in systems and data modelling, and programming scripting language (Python, R, OPAL, Javascript or anything similar)
Able to effectively communicate technical concepts to the planning community, capable of translating business requirements into technical concepts
Passion for collaboration and customer service mentality
Superior problem solving skills with an ability to anticipate issues and recommend solutions
Can-do (differently) attitude and get it done
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills (English mandatory)
Experience in project management, in a cross-functional and cross-cultural environment and willingness to work in a global organization
Experience & Education
Strong Experience in managing/using enterprise reporting applications (e.g BW, Tableau, etc)
Know-how of ERP systems, preferably OMP, SAP APO and SAP ERP
Experience in Supply chain planning is a plus
Degree in engineering, mathematics, informatics
APICS and/or SCOR certification, or associated relevant experience are a plus
Who we are
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.
As of January 4, 2022, Roche requires all new employees who work in Canada to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date they take office. This requirement is a condition of employment at Roche that applies regardless of whether the position is on a Roche campus or remotely. If you have a valid reason for not being fully immunized, which is limited to certain specific medical reasons or other valid reasons protected by applicable human rights laws, you may request an exemption and / or adaptation measures regarding this vaccination requirement.
Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Job Level:
Individual contributor

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Desc:
Overview:

It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.
Summary:
Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst is a skilled analytical professional who has significant hands-on experience with analysis and reporting as they relate to the merchandise productivity in a large organization. As an Analyst, you will be responsible to create and develop metrics, see opportunities in the business and help shape the vision for reporting and analysis at OSL.
 Responsibilities:
Work with the Business Intelligence Manager to determine the vision for reporting and builds a plan to execute on those goals
Work within a team to prioritize work and achieve team goals on time
Support the team with producing reports as required, scheduled or ad hoc
Assist in identifying opportunities in the business and works to produce impactful analysis
Examine reports and produce accurate data
Assist with the compilation and distribution of key financial and management reports
Liaise with internal and external clients on reporting needs to find effective solutions
Assist with new project opportunities to identify reporting and data system requirements
Candidate Qualifications:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases (SQL), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset
What we offer:
Competitive base salary plus bonuses and other perks
Vacation plus additional flex days
Comprehensive benefits
Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
A supportive workplace culture and work environment
Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

Title: Technical Support Operations Analyst (Remote)
Desc:
A Technical Support Operations Analyst works directly with our customer success leadership team to identify, prioritize, and lead key projects and initiatives. The position will report to a Manager, Customer Support within the Customer Success Team, and work extensively with various internal stakeholders.
What You Will Do at Prophix
As a trusted partner to our Customer Success team, you will develop a deep understanding of business opportunities and challenges. You will collaborate with internal stakeholder teams to execute and deliver results that maximize business impact and improve the overall efficiency and execution of the customer success organization.
Support day to day Zendesk maintenance activities

Zendesk

ACCESSIBILITY & DIVERSITY

Title: Lead Business Analyst
Desc:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Lead Business Analyst
Job Description
What is the Opportunity?
This is a Lead Business Analyst position at Royal Bank of Canada. Business Analysts in our group define and help deliver technology projects for the RBC Global Asset Management (RBC GAM) line of business and for the operations teams that support that line of business. RBC Global Asset Management is part of RBC Wealth Management, the largest full-service wealth manager in Canada and one of the top wealth managers in the world by client assets. For more information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/
Please Note: This position can be located in either Vancouver or Toronto
What will you do?
Lead the team while also contributing, as a seasoned BA/Product Owner, to projects
Define the required skillset and capabilities within the team and proactively acquire and grow talent
Focus resources on what matters most. Know what must be perfect versus get done
Lead by example and establish a culture of collaboration, learning and innovation
Deliver projects and work requests in Agile and Iterative Waterfall project frameworks
Prepare and deliver presentations to business partners and senior management for projects and to promote team achievements
Coach, mentor, set goals and do performance reviews
What do you need to succeed?
Must Have
2+ years of experience as a people manager in a technology setting
6+ years of Business Analysis experience
Passion for delivery, curiosity, and a track record of successful project delivery
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively and build relationships with both technical, operations and investment professionals
Strong leadership skills, demonstrated ability to influence tactical and strategic decisions
Excellent understanding of Software Development Life Cycle and change control
Experience delivering projects using the Agile framework
Nice to Have
Working experience in SQL, data visualizations, entity relationship diagrams, and other data modelling techniques
Experience delivering projects in large corporate environments, including front, middle, and back-office functions
System design and software development experience
Experience in financial services business or technology, Wealth Management, Global Asset Management, or Brokerage
Agile, PMI, ITIL certifications
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.
Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: HR Technology Analyst
Desc:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Job description
This is a temporary (18 month contract) role with remote work options available in Ontario.
The HR Technology Analyst (Reporting, Data Management & Security) will help bring proactive HR insights closer to users in an integrated, accessible and secure way. We are looking for someone who learns new systems with ease, can analyze a request to get to the heart of the issue, and who is comfortable working in a collaborative, team-oriented environment.
As a member of the Reporting, Data Management and Security squad, this role supports HR Systems security, production analytics, and data transformation across all HR Systems, with Workday HCM at the core. This squad ensures that workforce insights are proactively curated, designed and secured so that strategic insights are delivered to key decision-makers in the flow of work.
What will you do?
Design, build and test user-centric reports and dashboards in Workday and other reporting environments (SAP Webi, Tableau)
Provide prompt access to HR Systems, Reports and Data in compliance with Sun Life policies
Troubleshoot Workday reporting and security issues
Support the elimination of technical debt, including the redesign of the security framework and reduction of custom and scheduled reports
Contribute to effective governance of HR Data, including adding meta-data within Workday reports and supporting the classification and cataloging of data across HR Systems
Support system maintenance on all HR Systems through reviewing release notes and completing full cycle testing
Proactively recommend changes that enhance user experience, data quality and the effectiveness of analytics and dashboards
Participate as an active team member to suggest, triage, refine, plan and prioritize work
Follow and recommend improvements to internal standard operating procedures to ensure consistent quality and to mitigate risk
What do you need to succeed?
2+ years’ experience in HR Systems, IT, Data Analysis or a related field
Experience working with Workday Reporting, Security and Advanced Analytics is preferred
Working knowledge of Excel macros, Tableau, and VBA is an asset
Must be able to understand functional and technical details and think strategically to connect requests and implement standardized, globally scalable solutions
Dedicated commitment to customer service, clear communication and team collaboration
Proven ability to follow privacy and data classification policies
Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and high quality
Creative thinker with an innovative, growth mindset
#LI-Hybrid
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.
Sun Life is committed to the health and safety of all those in our workplaces and our communities. In accordance with Sun Life’s Vaccination Policy (Canada):
Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st. Employees in these roles may participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program as an alternative until April 30th.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Salary Range:
56,300/56 300 - 92,900/92 900
Job Category:
Human Resources
Posting End Date:
16/04/2022

Title: Business System Analyst
Desc:
Business System Analyst

Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our world class clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Business Analyst.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for Business System Analyst to join our Business Consulting team. This is a chance to join one of the fastest growing and exciting consultancies, with an opportunity to grow with the company as it expands.

Responsibilities

Establish collaborative relationships with external and internal stakeholders.
Working closely with clients to define and optimize their roadmap
Gather accurate requirements and create user stories
Strategically and creatively think about how the consumer experience should work; translating a vision to processes and requirements
Shaping and executing complex digital transformations

Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:

5+ years Business Analysis experience
Elaborate and elicit detailed technical user stories based on feature and epics prioritized via business roadmaps and desired outcomes
Key skillsets required:
Agile delivery experience
Ability to structure and derive technical details from business priorities, technical architecture and elicit sufficient details to provide clarity to clear scope and desired outcomes
Collaborative and ability to manage complex priorities
Cloud & multi tiered apps
Work with vendor and project teams to analyze and document data, process, integration details and specification for the teams' to follow
Support teams' to answer questions and triage issues
Liaison with both vendor and teams to align and coordinate details to produce a final set of specification, technical stories, intakes and any artifacts required to support the targeted scope (JIRA, Confluence a must)

Technical expertise and comfort working with APIs and JSON.


Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If you’re looking forward to progressing your career with us, then we’re looking forward to receiving your application.

Capco is well known for its thought leadership and client-centric model that distinguishes it from other consulting firms. Capco’s strong technology and digital knowledge base, it’s global experience of the Financial Service enables us to deliver projects from strategy through to delivery. We are committed to providing new areas of expertise from which our clients will greatly benefit. We have:

Access to industry-focused talent globally
Ability to leverage best-of-breed, innovative products and solutions for complex architecture and large-scale transformation
Extended global geographic market reach
Ability to capitalize on our client footprint and deep domain expertise within financial services

For more information about Capco, visit www.Capco.com.

Capco is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Title: Pricing Analyst
Desc:
Join our Business Analytics Team as a Pricing Analyst!
When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th to Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” isn’t just a catchy saying, it’s part of the #CARFAXdifference!

Our Pricing Analyst will join our rapidly growing Pricing group and report to the Head of B2B Pricing. Playing a key part in guiding pricing strategy and operations, this person will work closely with Product teams to support both product strategy and go-to-market initiatives.
As a Pricing Analyst you will:
Perform complex data analysis that will help to guide pricing strategy and operations
Proactively analyze product usage, billing and customer data to identify drivers of customer acquisition and churn
Collaborate with the Head of B2B Pricing to develop and enhance value based pricing models that align with pricing strategy
Work with technology teams to streamline reporting and operational pricing processes to reduce time to market
Ensure timeliness and accuracy of input data used in pricing models
Build statistical models to help with value-based customer segmentation, churn prediction and anomaly detection
Work with product teams to share value insights and support product development roadmap
To be considered you will need:
Bachelor’s degree is required, preferred degree in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Economics, or similar areas of focus
Minimum 3 years of experience in a business analytics role, at least one year focused on Pricing, ideally B2B
Advanced Excel skills (Pivot Tables, vlookups, conditional sums etc.)
Advanced proficiency querying databases using SQL
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Highly organized with attention to detail
A commitment to learning and continuous improvement
What’s nice to have:
Master’s degree with a quantitative focus
Experience querying data using Hive and/or Spark
Knowledge of a visualization tool such as MicroStrategy, Cognos, Tableau
Program language skills using R or Python
Offers of employment may be conditional upon providing evidence of COVID-19 full vaccination.

Title: Asset Management Analyst
Desc: The OpportunityThe Asset Management Data Analyst directly supports the Corporate Asset Management Office and asset owners in:AM data collection and analysis by developing and implementing business processes and tools to ensure accuracy and integrity.Developing decision frameworks, business processes, and tools that incorporate capital and operating budget development, prioritization, risk analysis, level of service, and life cycle costing.Financial analysis includes but is not limited to development of replacement and intervention costs, short and long-range reinvestment forecasts, life cycle analysis, and economic analysis.ResponsibilitiesYou will collaborate with internal teams and consulting services to complete various types of projects including:Asset Management Data Collection and Management including condition assessments dataLife-cycle analysis and forecasts, operations and maintenance standards development, maintenance and technical studies.Financial Analysis - Development of replacement and intervention costs, short- and long-range reinvestmentYou BringUniversity Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Engineering, Planning or related field or approved equivalent combination of education and experience, with specialization in Asset Management.Experience in public infrastructure asset management, including industry best practices, asset management business principles, life cycle costing, risk assessment, infrastructure renewal costing, and priority setting.Ability to develop and maintain infrastructure inventory databases and infrastructure condition assessments.Knowledge of condition assessment, inspection, rehabilitation and reconstruction techniques for linear and vertical infrastructure networks (such as transportation, stormwater, fleet, IT, and facilities).Experience with establishing infrastructure capital and operating budget requirements.Demonstrated experience with financial modeling, deterioration modeling, what-if analysis, etc…Demonstrated experience in cost/benefit analysis, risk management analysis, and processes combined with developing operational and capital budgetsHours35-hours per week.Salary/Wage$35.83 per hourSelection ProcessWe thank you in advance for your interest. Those selected for an interview will be contacted by phone or email. We will contact those who did not make it to the interview stage by email within one month of the closing date of this job posting.1. Submit a cover letter and resume using the "Apply Now" tab on this web page.2. Applications will be reviewed, shortlisted and interviews will be scheduled.Note: Once you apply and upload a resume you should receive an email confirming that your application has been submitted for this position. If you receive this email, there is NO further need to contact us regarding this position.This posting may be used to fill future vacancies in this position.This posting may be used to fill more than one position.This posting will be open until a suitable candidate(s) is/are found.Due to the high volume of applications that we receive per job posting, we are not able to answer job-specific questions before the interview stage. If you are successful in getting to the job interview stage, we will be more than happy to answer any questions you might have at that time.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $35.83 per hour

Title: Analyst, Business Analytics & Reporting, Summer 2022 (Co-op/Intern), 4 Months - Toronto
Desc:
Adresse :
55 Bloor Street West
Groupe de famille d'emploi :
Analyses données et rapports
As a co-op/intern at BMO, you will have the opportunity to be heard, keep growing and make a difference. You will be part of our campus program to gain the skills and knowledge needed to take on roles similar to the description listed below.

Our student experience is designed to integrate you to the BMO team from day one by adding value in the work you do. You will have the opportunity to participate in programs such as the Women in Technology Mentorship Program, BMO First Friend peer assignment, BMO Social Squad student-led activities, BMO U corporate learning platform and access to various Enterprise Resource Groups to further develop your network within BMO. Returning students joining us in Summer 2020 will have the opportunity to attend a 3 day Student Leadership Summit held at the BMO Institute for Learning.
Interested in learning more about our campus program? Stay up-to-date with BMO Campus Recruitment by following us on Twitter @BMOonCampus & Instagram @BMO_on_Campus .
Please ensure you upload your resume, cover letter and transcript in the ‘Upload a file’ section prior to submitting your application.
Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
Qualifications:
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
Completes complex & diverse tasks within given rules/limits and may include handling escalations from other employees.
Analyzes issues and determines next steps.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
As a full-time employee, we would require 2-3 years of experience, however as part of the BMO campus program, we are looking for motivated individuals with a strong desire to learn. Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - Good.
Specialized knowledge.
Verbal & written communication skills - Good.
Organization skillls - Good.
Collaboration & team skills - Good.
Analytical and problem solving skills - Good.
Ici, pour vous.
À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde.
En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences.
Pour en savoir plus, visitez-nous à l'adresse https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/fr .
BMO s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, équitable et accessible. Nous apprenons de nos différences et tirons notre force des gens et de leurs différents points de vue. Des mesures d’adaptation sont disponibles sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à tous les aspects du processus de sélection. Pour demander des mesures d’adaptation, veuillez communiquer avec votre recruteur.

Title: Business Data Analyst, Autodesk Customer Success Practice
Desc:
Job Requisition ID #
22WD58843
Position Overview
Autodesk is a world leader in 3D design, engineering and entertainment software and services. Our software is used by creators, designers, architects, engineers, video game developers and film makers around the world. Learn more about why Autodesk is continually ranked a top place to work by Fortune, Forbes, Glassdoor and others: Top 7 Reasons You Should Work at Autodesk . And check out what Autodesk employees are saying.
As a business analyst in the Autodesk Customer Success Practice team, you’ll be the principal owner of how we use data & analytics to inform strategic decisions and measure current execution status. You will help us measure the impact of the programs and tools we build to help our customers plan their success. You’ll have an opportunity to learn about some of the most impressive technologies that Autodesk is working on.
We are looking for a proactive, well-spoken, collaborative teammate to apply their love of data analytics and data visualization to quantify and provide insights into the adoption and use of our value management and success planning tools and content. If you like collaborating with cross-functional teams, owning projects start-to-finish, and using cutting edge analytics tools to do it - you will love this job.
Responsibilities
Work with various stakeholders to define the right metrics needed to measure the success of the tools, content, and programs we build
Identify the data points required to obtain those metrics, and work with our technical teams to instrument the tools we build in a way that provides the required data
Work with external teams to obtain additional data from our other business systems (e.g., Salesforce) that can enrich our metrics
Help define the best way to export and aggregate all the necessary data
Build and maintain self-serve dashboards to help team members and management easily understand how our programs are performing
Analyze the data, identify trends and areas of interest or risk, use the data to “tell a story”
Design, develop and generate periodic or ad-hoc reports and presentations in response to requests from upper management
Perform periodic audits of data consistency and accuracy
Look for opportunities to constantly improve our data and reporting processes, propose new ideas
Ensure the compliance of our data collection, storage and dashboarding processes with Autodesk security and privacy policies, GDPR, etc
Be the team’s “go-to person” for any questions or training related to metrics, dashboarding, best practices around collecting and interpreting data
Minimum Qualifications
2+ years of experience performing data analysis and visualizations
Ability to determine the right metrics and to make sense of complex data to tell a compelling story
Strong attention to detail and work ethic. Care deeply about data quality and integrity
Curiosity, thinking outside the box and always looking for opportunities to improve processes
Independent, fast learner, proactive, problem solver
Strong communication skills and written English. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership
Experience working with unstructured data (webpages and/or text) a plus
Experience with Microsoft PowerBI, Salesforce, AirTable, SQL, Snowflake a plus
Availability to occasionally travel as needed
We’d like to thank all applicants for their interest. Only selected applicants will be contacted for an interview.
Visit us at: www.autodesk.com
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers .

Title: Inventory Analyst
Desc:
Inventory Analyst
Primary Functions
Analyse customer demand and inventory balances & communicate them to planning scheduler
Analyse daily inventory transactions and fix all transactions errors.
Maintains and performs cycle counts and plant inventories as required.
Perform daily inventory counts of WIP, stampings, and gp12 areas, and provide count to master scheduler.
Actively participates in the APQP process on new & existing products for the materials department (CN implementation / GPMS)
Ensure timely delivery of month end reports
Ensure customer demand is met through monitoring schedule attainment and releasing all vendors/subcontractors for required material
Maintain integrity of key business activities inside IATF
Continuous improvement
Key Responsibilities
Establish inventory locations and maintain inventory levels to cover production schedules at all times
Monitor inventory at supplier and yield analysis and initiate charge backs of yield variances > 2.00%
Reconcile month-end inventory balances to physical counts at subcontractors and in plant, make adjustments and analyze root causes for variances
Performing document control and inventory analysis functions of physical inventory
Assisting production department with lot tracking reporting
Analyze customer demand and inventory balances & communicate them to planning scheduler to help make proper production schedule,
Analyze all vendor / sub contractor inventory variances, root causes, and correct.
Analyze inventory balances and material availability for production and compare to the production schedule
Coordinate engineering changes with production planning, customer service and engineering department to ensure timely part supply and prevent obsolescence
Responsible for implementation of corrective action if results in area of delivery performance, create and transmit once a week releases to vendor through ERP system (MRP)
Ensure that vendor releases are monitored and releases are driven by Pullmatic’s production schedule and shipments of incoming material and parts/components are on time
Assist in planning and ordering supplier releases - ensuring delivery and specification
Analysing data to look for trends and shifts in customer releases and plan to ensure appropriate supply of product from entire supply chain.
Track and manage supplier performance on an ongoing basis.
Investigate all transaction errors; perform root cause analysis, and corrective actions.
Report all supplier receiving discrepancies to supplier and purchasing department.
Key Qualifications/Requirements
Minimum completion of post secondary education in material management
Minimum of 3 years experience in ERP/purchasing in an automotive or related manufacturing environment
APICs certification or working toward certification in CPIM an asset
Computer literate: ERP systems (cmi knowledge preferred), Microsoft Office & MS outlook
Excellent English language communication skills (both verbal & written)
Excellent documentation & organizational skills
Strong leadership and organizational skills within a team environment
Working knowledge of IATF16949 & ISO14001 systems
WHMIS
Additional Information
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.
Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.
At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

Title: Senior Analyst-CPG Manufacturer
Desc:
Job Description
As part of this team, you will work together with our Consumer Packaged Goods clients to cultivate value-added partnership relationships. The goal is to become the primary and leading source of business insights for NielsenIQ’s clients.

As a Senior Analyst, you will add value through a strong understanding of client needs and providing them with the products, services and analytical insights that will help achieve their business goals. The successful candidate will have experience and/or knowledge in working with data , performing analysis integrating a wide variety of data sources and presenting to clients. You will work within a team environment where you will develop solid relationships with your own team and within the client organization.

The Ideal Candidate Will Have
Post-secondary degree in Marketing/Business and/or related field
4+ years of marketing, retail or category management experience
Strong analytical skills preferably in the CPG or Retail industry
Demonstrated ability to provide insight into the data and address client business issues
Excellent communication skills
Excellent presentation skills
Strong client relationship building/management skills
Knowledge of NielsenIQ products and services an asset
The aptitude to look for ways to challenge the status quo
Ability to multi-task and capable of independent decision making with a bold, nimble and collaborative approach to problem solving
Technically fluid with strong data manipulation , Excel skills and the ability to leverage technology as an enabler
Familiarity with using Power BI and/or Tableau
Accountable, results driven and open to new ideas and ongoing learning
Proactively create innovative insights that challenge the status quo
Strong sales mindset with the ability to influence and build strong client relationships

Additional Information
About NielsenIQ
NielsenIQ is a global measurement and data analytics company that provides the most complete and trusted view available of consumers and markets worldwide. We provide consumer packaged goods manufacturers/fast-moving consumer goods and retailers with accurate, actionable information and insights and a complete picture of the complex and changing marketplace that companies need to innovate and grow. Our approach marries proprietary NielsenIQ data with other data sources to help clients around the world understand what’s happening now, what’s happening next, and how to best act on this knowledge. We like to be in the middle of the action. That’s why you can find us at work in over 90 countries, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.niq.com.
NielsenIQ is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class.

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Desc:
Are you looking to join one of Canada's Greatest Places to Work and be a part of making it even better?

Mister Safety Shoes is growing our New Customer Success Department and looking for an exceptional Sales Analyst to join our team.
This is a Hybrid Work arrangement position, working our of our Toronto & Mississauga locations.


At Mister Safety Shoes we are always seeking great people to continually grow our company and strengthen our culture. We believe that great people drive our business. We are looking for open-minded, responsive, caring individuals like yourself who are excited about working in a fast-paced, goal driven environment.
What people say about you:


As a Sales Analyst, you are a partner to the business. You are passionate about building relationships and helping others succeed. You are meticulous and detail oriented. You are a self-starter with strong time management & organizational skills who like to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision.
What's in it for me?

An opportunity to join a newly created department with a focus on helping clients keep their Canadian employees safe by collecting, analyzing data to provide insights and recommendations that support sales, business accounts, forecasts, and business trends.

A day in the life:

By using Sales data analytics from Salesforce and Magstar- ERP system, provide actionable information and insights to the sales and customer success team.
Gain in-depth understanding of client needs, to ensure appropriate service levels with limited support and guidance.
demonstrate a comfort level in seeking out & maintaining relationships with multiple contacts within an organization and delivering superior levels of customer service.
What you bring:

Post-Secondary Education in a related field
Knowledge of BI/Analytics platforms. Certifications are an asset-
Previous analysis and CRM experience (We use Salesforce)
Advanced proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook
Comfort in effectively meeting deadlines, managing conflicting priorities, and understanding business needs.
Delivering information to a wide variety of users
Integrity, professionalism and excellent communication and interpersonal skills that are required to handle both internal and external communications with tact and diplomacy
A sense of humor and an ability to work within a dedicated team of good-hearted people.

What we offer:


Mister Safety Shoes is celebrating our 50th year anniversary as a Canadian Company.
We offer a competitive compensation package, perks and benefits.


Is this the career step you've been seeking?


Tell us why you are right for this role by submitting your resume and let's chat about it!


Mister Safety Shoes has been certified as a Great Place to Work® and is proud to be a Best Workplaces™ in Canada in Retail and Hospitality & Best Workplaces™ in Ontario
We are an equal opportunity employer and positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates. If required, please include accommodation requirements with your submission.

Title: Business Analyst - Data Governance
Desc:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
  


    Job Level
   NV-10
   As a business analyst, data governance, you will help define and develop strategic planning and monitoring activities, and track business plans and performance. You will help establish targets and identify service delivery improvement opportunities, and support the design and delivery of business strategies and solutions in line with the business architecture of the various projects or as part of the transformation and development of Desjardins Group.
  
 Your role will be to analyze the organization’s business environment and needs in connection with innovative, wide-scale projects and initiatives. You will target, design and recommend business solutions. You will analyze their impacts on the organization, and ensure they’re integrated, from needs assessment to rollout. The nature of the initiatives and projects will require in-depth and extensive expertise in your field.
  
 You will make recommendations on the development and delivery of files and projects with a high degree of operational and conceptual complexity. These will require analysis and a comprehensive, detailed understanding of the business and the organization, as well as an ability to manage uncertainty and ambiguity. Coordination will be critical, and you will be required to interact with a large number of stakeholders who are experts in a variety of fields. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to balance the interests of multiple parties will therefore be essential.
  
 You will act as a specialist and play a leadership role for organizational bodies and work teams.
  

    General Information on the Position
  


    Plus précisément, vous faites partie d’une équipe d’une dizaine de personnes avec des profils complémentaires qui visent à développer une surveillance globale et intégrée des risques de donnée auxquels est exposé le Mouvement Desjardins. Cette équipe de 2e ligne de défense assure une surveillance efficace des risques de données et contribue au rehaussement des pratiques opérationnelles en collaboration avec les équipes des différentes composantes du Mouvement Desjardins.
  


    Responsabilités principales
  



      Développer et mettre en place des algorithmes, des règles d’affaires et des tests statistiques afin de détecter les anomalies de données dans les environnements Desjardins
    


      Coordonner, suivre, mesurer et communiquer la performance des contrôles de qualité déployés dans le cadre de la surveillance des encadrements de qualité de données dans les différentes entités du Mouvement
    


      Développer, opérationnaliser et faire évoluer les standards, processus, outils ainsi que les meilleures pratiques en lien avec les contrôles de qualité de données
    


      Surveiller l'efficacité des contrôles de données mis en place par les différents secteurs et faire les recommandations appropriées dans une perspective d'amélioration continue
    


      Opérationnaliser un processus de signalement des anomalies de données afin de commander les corrections aux dossiers par les premières lignes
    


      Accompagner des projets en lien avec l'évolution de la gouvernance des données.
    



    Conditions particulières
  



      Lieu de travail: Présentement en télétravail régulier découlant du contexte de la pandémie. Le mode de travail s’appliquant au poste est le mode hybride #LI-Hybrid
    


      Nombre d’emploi disponible : 1
    



    Profil recherché
  



      Baccalauréat dans une discipline appropriée
    


      Un minimum de six ans d’expérience pertinente
    



    Veuillez noter que d’autres combinaisons de formation et d’expérience pertinentes pourraient être considérées
  



      Pour les postes vacants disponibles au Québec, veuillez noter que la connaissance du français est nécessaire
    



    Connaissances spécifiques
  



      Maîtrise de la suite Office
    


      Connaissance de la programmation SQL
    


      Connaissance de SAS, R, Matlab (un atout)
    


      Connaissance du langage de programmation Python (un atout)
    


      Connaissance du cloud Microsoft Azure (un atout)
    


      Connaissance des procédures SAS (un atout)
