Title: Business Systems Analyst
Desc:
Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.

Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.

How do we make work life better?

By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences
By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism
By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users

We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!

Location: For this role we are open to remote work located anywhere within the United States or Canada.

About the Opportunity:
Ceridian Data eXchange (CDX) is a comprehensive set of people, process and technology, used to direct and regulate the data integration between internal and external systems.
Dayforce Link is a centralized, secure cloud solution for internal and edge-based file transfers, including data transformation. Dayforce Link collects, transforms and delivers customer data both to and from internal Ceridian systems, as well as external trading partners.

What you’ll get to do:
Application Administration, Configuration, & Maintenance

Design, planning and implementation/engineering of integration solutions using IBM MFT Suite (Sterling File Gateway, Sterling Integrator, Sterling Secure Proxy/SEAS, IBM Control Center, IBM Perimeter Servers, etc)
Perform ifix’s and application upgrades
System testing, tuning and capacity planning
Monitor active Business Processes and assigned schedules
Experience with clustered architectures and associated High Availability, workload management and Disaster Recovery practices.
Configure and manage Routing Channel Templates
Design and support of Business Processes using the IBM Graphical Process Modeling tool
Command Line Adapter configuration, including working with Antivirus, GPG and network file sharing
MFT Trading Partner configuration setup using IBM Sterling Secure Proxy, using various communication protocols (SFTP, FTPS, HTTPS, FTP, SMB, Connect: Direct, etc)
Knowledge of Web services using methods such as soap and restful
Create custom file layers and custom email notifications
Perform technical configurations, such as network communications and adapter configuration
Onboard new employees by creating and supporting user accounts and user groups
Use audit records and trace logs to provide reporting as required

Security Standards

Ensure that the Command Line Adapter 2 is continually working with antivirus
Ensures all file transmissions and adapters are secured according to InfoSec standards
Manage GPG/PGP Keys to ensure they are functioning as required
Assist the Application Administrator with regular DR tests as required by BCP Team
Setup and manage services and adapters (i.e. SFTP/SMB/etc) including custom protocols as required
Proficient in various B2B communication protocols such as FTP, FTPS, SFTP, HTTP, HTTP/S, AS2, etc

Environments

Responsible for managing all environmental instances including Production, DR, Dev, and Test
Ensures each environment is built appropriately and functioning as required
Ensures data sets for each environment are sanitized as required
Deploy Resource Manager objects from environment to environment

Incident Support (Tier 3)

Act as an escalation point for Production Operators and Route Provisioners, by providing high-end technical support. This includes:

o. Product navigation (i.e. guidance around, and execution of complex tasks within the technology portfolio)
p. Data mining (i.e. investigating variances in data transactions totals)
q. Customer interaction (i.e. escalation point for customer concerns)

Track and update all incidents in the incident management system, ensuring that documentation is thorough, accurate and meets ticket quality standards and is resolved in a timely manner.
Review tickets for repetitive issues and collaborate with support teams to identify effective/sound solutions that will resolve these conclusively.

Change Management

Primary individual responsible for opening change requests
Ensures all environmental changes follow the proper change controls

Skills and Experience we value:

5+ Years practical experience as an application architect
Bachelors Degree in computer science or information systems preferred
Thorough knowledge in Unix/Linux platforms and writing shell scripts
Thorough knowledge of B2Bi and under laying technologies (BPML, XML, Xpath, SQL, network topologies and MFT)
Experience working with the following suite of IBM MFT technologies:

o. IBM Sterling File Gateway
p. IBM Sterling B2B Integrator
q. IBM Control Center
r. IBM Connect: Direct
s. IBM SEAS
t. IBM Secure Proxy CM
u. IBM Transformation Extender (ITX)

Required to understand and uphold all Ceridian Data eXchange, Infrastructure, Infosec, Privacy policies and standards

Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Title: Technical Business Systems Analyst
Desc:
Reference Number: 9759
Department: Corp. Information Technology
Location: Halifax, NS
Type of Employment: Reg, FT

Nova Scotia Power’s greatest source of energy is our people. In a culture focused on safety, we’re committed to providing exceptional service to our customers and rewarding jobs to our employees. We’re hiring solution-minded people excited to help us grow into the future. We are currently seeking a Technical Business Systems Analyst to join our ERP Application Support Team in a full-time permanent position.

Accountabilities:
Under the direction of the Manager, ERP-SCM Application Support, the Intermediate Technical Business Systems Analyst is accountable for supporting, maintaining, and evolving enterprise level computer systems to meet established customer service levels and maintain IT Operations best practices.

The Intermediate Technical Business Systems Analyst needs to have the technical ability to support our ERP applications and bring an understanding of application related business processes. The position is responsible for day to day application support of our Oracle R12 EBS Purchasing and Inventory modules including the ability to:
Troubleshoot and resolve application incidents following standard Incident Management procedures;Assess, prioritize, and complete application requests in a timely and quality manner following standard Request Management procedures;Manage application support issues, requests, and associated customer communications proactively to completion using standard tracking tools;Manage and execute application changes using standard Change Management methodologies;Perform proactive application error and health monitoring;Support and enforce corporate application security policies and procedures;Perform audit controls and reporting related to application access and usage;Effectively self–manage and re-prioritize work to balance resolution of incidents, request fulfillment, and project work to ensure highest priority issues are addressed and deadlines are met;Interact with vendors to resolve application incidents and problems, and research information;Work collaboratively and maintain relationships with business partners, system users, peers, and vendors;Satisfy customer reporting requests through customer education of system functionality or development and execution of reporting, as appropriate;Answer customer questions regarding application usage;Provide after-hours support by participating in an on-call rotation with the ERP technical support team;Complete application system administration requests in a timely and quality manner;Recognize and identify potential areas where existing business policies and procedures require change, or where new ones need to be developed, and make recommendations;Ensure effective use of application security and controls by communicating application policies, procedures, and practices to the application users.

You will be responsible for your personal safety and that of co-workers by observing all Occupational Health and Safety Rules and Regulations.

Skills, Capabilities and Experience:
The successful candidate will have a University degree or diploma in a computer related discipline and a minimum of two (2) years’ experience in technical client facing support roles with Oracle ERP Systems. An understanding and experience utilizing best practice information technology incident and request management processes is essential.

The ideal candidate will have:
Sound Oracle EBS R12 ERP Systems support experience for Purchasing and Inventory modules;Strong SQL skills;Solid analytical and problem-solving skills;Strong report development skills – specifically the ability to effectively confirm requirements, understand data models and build accurate and effective queries and reports;Excellent interpersonal and communications skills: the ability to communicate with end users to determine details of issues being experienced, and to clearly define request requirements;Ability to understand and bring experience utilizing information technology incident and request management processes and systems.

The following would be an asset:
ITIL Foundations training;Experience performing proactive IT audit controls;Working knowledge and experience with access security and controls;Experience satisfying internal and external audit requests for information and evidence;Understanding of accounting and financial concepts in relation to business processes;Experience with Maximo and Maximo integrations with Oracle EBS;Experience with PowerPlan.

At Nova Scotia Power, our employees are our greatest strength. Our Leadership Competencies set standards that advance our business strategy, deliver results for customers, and provide career development for employees. As the ideal candidate for this position, you speak up on health, safety, and environment issues, and demonstrate a belief that all injuries are preventable. You support flexibility in the workplace and embrace change. A Technical Business Systems Analyst builds strong collaborative relationships with a commitment to a respectful, inclusive, and productive work environment while demonstrating integrity and a commitment to operational excellence for our customers. Lastly, we encourage you to proactively ask questions and seek information to understand how your work relates to the business goals and make well informed decisions.

In accordance with Emera’s occupational health and safety program and the Emera Vaccine Program, subject to any approved accommodation, all employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. For clarity, “fully vaccinated” means having the number of doses or combination of doses of a vaccine approved by Health Canada or local public health agencies in the jurisdiction in which they will be employed.

Reports to: SCM Business Manager, Corp. Information Technology

Form of Application: Complete all required information fields and copy and paste your covering letter and resume into the online form.

Salary: To commensurate with qualifications and experience

Must Be Received By: All interested candidates should apply no later than 20th April,2022.

Late applications may not receive consideration.

Recruitment and Promotion Policy: At Nova Scotia Power we believe that it is powerful when everyone is included.

We strongly encourage applications from equity groups who have been historically underrepresented, including members of the visible minority community (especially those from historic African Nova Scotian communities), Indigenous peoples (especially Mi’kmaq), persons with disabilities, and women in non-traditional roles, as well as members of the LGBTQ+ community.

If you are selected for an interview and require a specific accommodation, please advise our Talent Acquisition team and we will support you with the recruitment process.

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence Consulting
Desc:
Type: Permanent/Full-time/Remote work
Location: e-Office Environment
Compensation: Based Salary to commensurate with experience + Individual Bonus + 4 weeks’ vacation + Benefits Package, Health and Dental, 100% Employer Paid Premiums + Pension Plan 6% Employer Matching + Paid Annual Corporate Vacation & More.
Position Overview:
Our Technical Consultants who focus on Business Intelligence Reporting work directly with c-suite Finance, IT, and Operations personnel in law firms to customize, develop, and implement industry leading BI reports. Our BI reports provide fresh data that give clear insight into a firm’s operation. This data propels our clients towards streamlining internal processes which awards them with a strong competitive advantage in their market. As the Manager, you will oversee client projects for the BI Consulting Team as well as be the technical lead for your own projects where you will take a customer centric approach while applying customized, innovative and quality technical solutions from requirements gathering to go live implementations. You will work closely with the Director of BI Consulting, Technical Consultants, Project Managers as well as our Innovation Team and/or Managing Partners. This role will require remote management of Consultants, Clients and respective projects.
Responsibilities:
Provide ongoing support to a team of experienced Business Intelligence Consultants.
Work closely with BI Consultants to ensure smooth facilitation of BI client projects.
Handle escalations/questions from consultants and clients on Business Intelligence reporting.
Lead consultation with law firm clients to gather technical project requirements.
Provide ongoing support and training on reporting tools that interact with Elite 3E and Aderant to clients.
Customize and configure applications to agreed requirement specifications.
Design, develop and document technical solutions in 3E and Aderant.
Assist with the development and execution of technical solutions with a remote project team.
Analyze client requirements and provide project quotes.
Train end users and customer development staff in the functionality of products.
Work with Division Director and HR on planning staffing levels and recruitment.
Assist Division Director with ongoing coaching, mentorship and skills development of team.
Required Experience:
7+ years of experience performing Business Analysis – requirement gathering and documentation
7+ years of experience in an IT, Software Development, or Consulting role
Minimum 1+ years’ experience in a leadership capacity.
Strong expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) Team Skills:
PowerBI: Dashboard Design, Visualization and Development; Security and Administration
MDAX and Tabular Model
SSRS – SQL Server Reporting Services: SSRS Report Builder: Paginated Reports; Drill Down and Drill through, SSRS Reports Server Configuration and Management, T-SQL, SQL Server
PowerQuery/PowerPivot
Proven experience of familiarity with performing query optimization and data validation.
Hands on experience with other reporting tools – Business Objects, Crystal Reports, Tableau and/or TM1
Must possess Advanced Excel skills
University Degree in Information Technology, Software Development or a Business Degree with a certification in IT or Software Development.
Working Conditions:
25% Travel to the US &/or Canada
75% working from home remote office
Datolite Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All applications for this role will be considered; however, only short-listed candidates will be contacted
What we offer
Opportunity to join a growing technology consulting firm.
Competitive compensation packages.
Incentive programs based on achievements.
Flexibility of working from remote location or home office.
Competitive total benefits package.

Title: Human Resources Corporate Analyst
Desc:
Job Level: RÉ-05 $68,641 to $91,072

Closing Date: 22/04/22


Human Resources Corporate Analyst

The Human Resources Branch is looking for a Human Resources Corporate Analyst for a permanent position. The position is classified as an RÉ-05 ($68,641 to $91,072 per annum).


ABOUT US

The National Capital Commission (NCC) is the federal Crown Corporation dedicated to ensuring that Canada’s Capital is a dynamic and inspiring source of pride for all Canadians and a legacy for generations to come. Building on more than a century of experience, the NCC provides unique value in the Capital Region by fulfilling three specific roles: long-term planner of federal lands, principal steward of nationally significant public places, and creative partner committed to excellence in development and conservation.

Year after year, the NCC has been recognized as one of National Capital Region’s top employers as well as recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers. NCC employees can deploy to departments and separate agencies in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act.


DETAILED JOB DESCRIPTION

Reporting to the Manager, HR Corporate Programs and Policies, the incumbent provides research and advisory services and is responsible for gathering data, analysis and writing and, preparing supporting documentation. The incumbent provides management with information on best practices, strategies, policies and programs from a range of public and private sources in a broad range of areas such as, but not limited to:

Staffing, Corporate Human Resources, Classification, Labour Relations, HR planning, Employee engagement, Performance and Talent management, Organizational development, Training and development, Employee onboarding, HR programs, Official languages, Employment Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, GBA+, Multiculturalism, Employee recognition, HR reporting, Occupational Health and Safety (includes workplace harassment and violence prevention & workplace wellbeing, Employee Assistance Programs), Disability and return to work management, Duty to Accommodate, Informal conflict management or Change management, equitable compensation, awards and recognition, onboarding.

Special challenges of this position include being an agent of change, influencing HR management by keeping abreast of trends and best practices in human resources, developing and implementing high impact solutions/programs that will attract, retain and develop talent as well as enhance the NCC’s overall employee experience while understanding the operational and HR needs of the National Capital Commission.

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION: University degree with specialization in the field of Human Resources or in a related discipline or an acceptable combination of education, training and experience related to the position.

EXPERIENCE:

Progressive experience providing advice to clients and/or senior managers in at least two people management (HR) disciplines.
Experience conducting research and analysis.
Experience creating related briefing material (such as reports, briefing notes, presentations, recommendations etc.).
Experience applying diversity and inclusion principles (including but not limited to GBA+, employment equity).

KNOWLEDGE

Knowledge of federal public sector people management legislation and policies.
Knowledge of policy life cycle management development.

ABILITIES

To apply analytical skills on complex questions/cases and in recommending solutions, options or strategies.
To provide advice on the interpretation or application of people management legislation and policies in the federal public sector.
To draft and edit written material.
To plan, prioritize and coordinate multiple projects to meet client expectations, priorities and deadlines.

COMPETENCIES:

Demonstrating Integrity and Respect Civility and Well-Being,
Thinking Things Through - Innovating Through Analysis and Ideas;
Working Effectively with Others – Relationships and Trust Building; and
Showing Initiative and Being Action-Oriented – Getting Things Done

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Possess or eligible to obtain Reliability security clearance;
Linguistic profile: Bilingual BBB/BBB;
Position is in the National Capital Region. The candidate must reside within a commutable distance from the workplace (40 Elgin Street, Ottawa, Ontario); et
All employees of the core public administration, including the NCC as a crown corporation are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and attest to their vaccination status unless accommodated based on a certified medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act. The requirement for employees to be fully vaccinated applies whether they are teleworking, working remotely or working on-site. This is a condition of employment and it applies to indeterminate (permanent), determinate (term), casual, and student hiring. Should you reach the point in the selection process where it is necessary to verify terms and conditions of employment then the hiring manager or a human resources representative will contact you in order to complete an attestation.

ASSETS

Experience developing policy documents, such as, but not limited to, policies, guidelines, and/or guidance.
Two or more years of experience providing people management program support and/or advisory services in the Core public administration.
Experience in more than two people management disciplines.

The National Capital Commission is committed to establishing and maintaining a representative workforce. Preference may be given to qualified candidates who self-declare as members of a visible minority group, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities or women (in non-traditional occupations).

Preference may be given to Persons employed in the public service.


The NCC is committed to building a skilled, diverse workforce reflective of Canadian society. As a result, it promotes employment equity and encourages candidates to indicate voluntarily in their application if they are a woman, an Indigenous person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group.

The NCC is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted regarding this competition, please advise the Human Resources representative of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. If you require additional information on the position or if you are experiencing technical difficulties, please contact us at hr.recruitment@ncc-ccn.ca.

Hearing impaired and speech impaired persons can contact us through a Teletype Device (TTY) at (613) 239-5090 or 1-866-661-3530 (toll free).

Title: Salesforce Business Analyst
Desc:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Perkins + Will, our Instagram, and our Blog.
                   








We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.
 Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.
 Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable. We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!
              














What does the Salesforce Business Analyst look like?
 At Bench we're aiming to make a profound difference in the lives of our customers, by making entrepreneurship more accessible. We are doing this by delivering disruptively affordable and simple accounting services for small businesses in the US - where 80% of business owners today either do not do any bookkeeping; or, struggle to do it themselves.
 Reporting to our Team Lead of Business Operations Systems and Analytics, you'll be a critical team member helping implement an exciting, best-in-class, go-to-market system and process transformation. While you bring technical Salesforce knowledge and experience, you'll greatly expand your Salesforce experience and technical knowledge working with a highly skilled team to improve the user experience for the day-to-day sales and marketing activities and analytical decisions. With the Business Operations and analytics team members around you, you'll drive a transformation of how systems, data, and analytics support Bench's business from Salesforce. As a Salesforce Business Analyst, you'll be leading process workshops, collaborating with Marketing and Sales Leaders to understand their process requirements, then working closely with technical teams to create outstanding solutions for Bench!
 What you'll get up to:

Be responsible for configuration, design functionality, and end-user support of the Salesforce platform.
Analyze our current structure for all aspects of user and license management
Collaborate with various internal departments (Sales, Account Management, Retro) to ensure Salesforce environment continues to evolve for internal needs relating to functionality and performance
Establish and implement change control and best practices with regard to system maintenance, configuration, development, testing, data integrity, etc.
Analyze the applications connected to Salesforce, including but not limited to Salesforce CPQ, Marketo, Salesloft, Distribution Engine, etc.
Identify production risks and areas for improvement; prioritize, design, and facilitate successful implementation and adoption of new processes.
Develop and implement training for end-users. Create and maintain all training materials and guides for processes related to Salesforce business applications.
Be accountable and results focused, including building strong relationships with others based on integrity and authenticity
Make mistakes and face challenges, but be motivated to learn fast from them and make high impact technical system improvements
Embrace feedback with arms wide open and action it to further your success
Be able to contribute to a high-performing team by bringing lots of mental horsepower, amazing work ethic, positive energy, and a little weirdness to keep things interesting

What you'll need:

3+ years of previous experience as a Salesforce Admin
Previous experience configuring and supporting the existing salesforce infrastructure including custom objects, record types, fields, page layouts, formulas, data validation rules, flows, etc. 
2+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst, gathering business requirements from Sales or Marketing Teams, documenting processes, and building business cases for Salesforce implementations
Extensive experience with Process Improvement, identifying bottleneck, and creating process diagrams
Conduct system review sessions to optimize and streamline processes Running workshops for requirements gathering Demoing future state processes 
Extensive experience breaking down the requirements backlog into logical subparts for Salesforce developers and administrators
For example: writing technical requirements for Salesforce Developers & Admin in Google Sheets or Jira 
One of the following certifications: Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Advanced Admin, or Salesforce App Builder
An ability to collaborate with GTM Leaders and Senior Stakeholders to understand their process and workflow requirements and then develop an appropriate business case for specific managed packages within the Salesforce Ecosystem.
Experience analyzing or creating business cases for managed packages.
Be extremely interested and motivated to learn more about the Salesforce Platform
A genuine passion for helping people that create outstanding internal user experiences

It could be an even better fit if you have:

Experience with a combination of Agile and Waterfall (in the future we will be moving towards a more formal Agile Framework utilizing Scrum or Kanban).
An understanding of data structures, data flows, and data modeling.
Knowledge of object-oriented methodologies and approaches (so you can collaborate better with Salesforce Developers)

What you'll get:

At Bench we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $72,720 - $90,900 per year, depending on experience,
In addition,we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options and full health, dental, and vision.
You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
Our HQ is in downtown Vancouver BC, where we offer hybrid and remote working opportunities. This full-time position also has the flexibility to work remotely from anywhere else in BC, as well as Alberta, Ontario, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia.
Whether working remote or hybrid, we'll set you up with everything you need to work from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.
 We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Desc:
Requisition ID: 144340

Cost Centre: CANADA CC SUPPORT FUNCTIONS

Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward: $1,000.00

We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.
Purpose
Contributes to the overall success of the CCC – National Operations, MIS and Analytics in Canada ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed / delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
Accountabilities
Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
Create, review and maintain/distribute of necessary reporting required to achieve key performance indicators, service level agreement and operational business controls.
Create and maintain reporting necessary to achieve RISA contractual service levels and identified compliance/regulatory controls.
Develop and maintain reports for the senior leadership team and frontline managers aligned with the strategic objectives.
Create and maintain the governance model for the online reporting portals (including documentation and set up controls)
Provide analysis of business data using spreadsheet and database tools Work closely with team members, business partners, and management to clearly understand business and/or data requirements to provide intuitive files/reporting in user friendly format. Maintaining nationwide scorecards, ad-hoc reports etc.
Develop and maintain complex databases and reporting to support Department needs. This will include current reporting and future developments aligned with strategic objectives.
Prepare spreadsheets/reports for trending info/analysis, obtaining and reviewing explanations for discrepancies as well as preparing management reports for review which includes analysis and recommendations. This includes providing analytical support in the implementation or review of new/existing projects, systems, processes and technology as well as assisting in the delivery and implementation of solutions as required.
Interpersonal skills, with an ability to maintain strong and influential relationships with business area managers and executives.
In depth knowledge of business related computer software specifically Data Warehouse methodology, MS Access, Excel, PowerPoint and Word (data import/export), VISIO.
Manage and support analysis for a variety of ad-hoc and recurring reports.
Perform as a trusted business advisor and provide consultations to requestors regarding data collection strategies, targeted search items, scoping parameters and recommend effective new strategies as required.
Perform other duties as assigned
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Champions a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment.
Education / Experience
Information Systems Management Certificate.
Degree in Bachelor of Commerce
Excel programming and Microsoft Access skills including queries, forms, reports and macros
Reporting design and solutioning experience preferably in Power BI
Strong understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies and experience working in Scrum environment (Jira and Confluence)
Strong communication skills essential with clients, vendors and management
Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation and relationship building skills
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written
Skilled background in statistical and quantitative analysis
Proficiency in using MS Office (MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint), visual basic/excel macros knowledge
Excellent communication skills (oral and written)
Knowledge of CCC processes and systems
10 years of experience in Data Analytics and Business Analysis
8+ years banking experience.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto || Canada : Nova Scotia : Halifax || Canada : Ontario : Ottawa

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Note: All postings in me@Scotiabank will remain live for a minimum of 5 days.

Title: Housing Business Systems Analyst (Student Housing & Residence Life)
Desc:
****Please visit https://www.trentu.ca/humanresources/employment-opportunities/non-academic-positions to apply for this job. Applications submitted directly via job boards will not be accepted.****
Job Purpose: 
Reporting to the Assistant Director Residence Operations & Services, the Housing Business Systems Analyst position operates with a high level of autonomy to lead design thinking activities working with students, end users, and campus partners to implement systems, technology solutions, and/or business process improvements using data-informed practices.
Working with IT and campus partners, this position analyzes, evaluates, recommends, and develops systems for problem resolution, expansion, optimization, or integration. As part of this work, the incumbent will prepare and maintain system documents, operating procedures, information risk and security management protocols, specifications, works plans and records. This position receives and manages confidential, personal, and proprietary information using sound judgment responsible to ensure policy and legislative requirements are achieved.
Key Activities: 
Business Systems Analysis
· Meet with decision makes, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirement and system outcomes, and identify and resolve systems and business process issues.
· Lead design sessions in prototyping new systems for the purpose of enhancing business process, operations, and information process flow.
· Lead review sessions of existing systems and business processes. Develop and
implement strategies to get the full use and benefits of system that have been previously deployed.
· Identify and establish scope and parameters of systems analysis in order to define outcome criteria and measure-taking actions.
· Collaborate in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications, and enhancements to existing applications.
· Conduct research on software and hardware products to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts
· Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems across the organization.
· Create system design proposals.
· Perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.
· Ensure compatibility and interoperability of in-house computing systems.
Systems Administrator
· Serve as the institutional administrator for the Student Housing management system (StarRez). This includes administering the system for the following user groups: Student Housing & Residence Life, Conference Services, TrentU Card, and Student Affairs.
· Work extensively with StarRez housing information system to set up and maintain modules, and reporting. Manages requests on improvements to system from various departments. This includes troubleshooting issues expressed by users and administrators, communicating with and managing StarRez and IT tickets as necessary
· Works directly with IT on StarRez integration with Colleague and APIs
· Lead and develop complex reports for the Assistant Director that detail business process reviews that have taken place and the recommended action plans
· Manage all software updates and upgrades, ensuring coordination with campus partners and software provider
· Lead the department in the analysis of the housing management system and recommendations for moving forward and modernizing the system
· Receives requests from department users for modifications, tracks requests, and processes requests with service provider
· Acts as a subject matter expert and resource for the housing software system (StarRez)
Decision Support & Reporting
· Produces complex queries, exports, reports, analyses and lists to meet the needs of the department and user groups using integrated systems and data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableu, Zoho analytics)
· Supports the administration of assessment and survey tools to solicit feedback (qualitative and quantitative) to improve and enhance the student experience
· Leads the production of standard reporting tools within the housing department, including monthly, quarterly and annual reports and other information based the guidelines from the Housing Leadership Team
· Prepare and distribute weekly, monthly and annual statistical reports for use in operational decision making, budgeting, recruiting, programming, etc.
· Prepare with the Financial Officer monthly occupancy and financial occupancy reports for the Housing Leadership Team
· Collects, analyzes, and interprets data pertaining to occupancy and institutional enrollment goals, providing accurate data to the Assistant Director for use in forecasting
Systems Administrator
· Administer security settings and user access for the housing management system, in accordance with established procedures from the Assistant Director
· Develop procedures meeting legal requirements relating to the safeguarding of student information within all department software platforms
· Regularly conduct system penetration tests, disaster recovery simulations and other simulated emergency exercises to assess overall readiness of all housing software platforms.
· Develop and maintain a housing IT disaster recovery, business continuity and emergency operations plan to integrate with the overall university risk management practices.
Other
· Perform work related to special projects within housing (e.g., implementation of new software systems, assessment processes and procedures, etc.)
· Under the general direction of the Assistant Director, develops, revises, and implements memorandums of understanding for the use of the housing software system (e.g., Conference Services, TrentU Card Office, Student Affairs, etc.)
· Represents the department on committees, task forces, and working groups as required
· Upholds residence agreement and policies when necessary
· Participate in planning and execution of move in/move out processes, working collaboratively with housing services staff
Education Required: 
· Honors University Degree (4 year) in Business Administration, Computer Science, or Management Information Systems is required.
· Business Analyst certification is considered an asset.
Experience/Qualifications Required: 
· Five years directly related experience. Preference given to candidates with multiple years of experience in a post-secondary housing setting.
· Proven experience in overseeing the design, development and implementation of software and hardware solutions, systems, or products.
· Significant experience implementing and troubleshooting web-based applications.
· Training and experience in website design and server-based programming including HTML, JavaScript, CSS, PHP and XML.
· A strong understanding of networking technologies and their interaction with web-based applications.
· Extensive practical knowledge in importing data for use in report software, spreadsheets, graphs, and flow charts.
· Demonstrated experience with data collection, report design and application of data analytic tools (Power BI, Pivot tables, dashboards, or other data visualization platforms)
· High proficiency in database/spreadsheet (MS Access/MS Excel) software; knowledge of core software applications, including StarRez an asset.
· Excellent data analysis skills, documenting workflows, developing process maps, and the ability to translate data into recommendations and concise reports.
· Proven experience in the operation and analysis of database and systems design/architecture, as well as data retrieval methodologies to achieve user needs.
· Demonstrated project management skills
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $42.69-$50.40 per hour
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-04-19

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Desc:
JP#22-14T
Business Intelligence Developer
3 year Temporary Full-Time

 If you are civic minded and interested in making an impact on people and businesses on the beautiful North Shore, consider working for the District of North Vancouver.
  
 Home to vast parkland and attractions including Grouse Mountain, Lynn Canyon and Capilano Suspension Bridge, the District is inspired by nature, and enriched by people. As one of 
  BC’s Top Employers, the District offers exciting professional development opportunities and a competitive total compensation package including a compressed day off schedule (nine-day fortnight). This is an exciting time to join the District, as we embark on a range of initiatives to transform digital service delivery, customer experience, and our approach to climate action.
  
 The District of North Vancouver is searching for a talented Business Intelligence (BI) developer to join our growing team of data enthusiasts. In this role, you will draw on organizational and external data sources to develop various analytic reports and dashboards for Senior Management and other interested parties. You will work with business users, gather requirements, and update existing BI reports as well as develop new BI reports as required. The BI developer will also aid in establishing organization wide data and reporting standards, define common terminology, and help to align existing and future reporting requests. Finally, they will interact with team members whenever data schemas require redesign in order to ensure the accommodation of new reporting requirements.
  

Who we are
 We are a growing, multi-disciplinary team of technology professionals focused on providing our customers and colleagues the right solutions to help them succeed. We love what we do and take pride in delivering what our customers need, and we have been recognized for the innovative and high-quality work that we have delivered.
  

What we’re looking for
 We’re looking for a talented individual to join our team for at least three years. You will be the lead BI Developer in a predominantly Microsoft shop and will work closely with both our Business customers throughout the organization and skilled technical architects, technology infrastructure specialists, and usability and user experience professionals. You will help apply the latest technology and aid the District in making informed decisions on how best to transform government services. Your responsibilities may include: 
  
Collecting business reporting requirements and translating them into technical specifications.
Developing database queries and conducting analyses.
Creating visualizations and reports for requested projects.
Analysing existing reports and optimizing them for standardization across the organization.
Proposing schema and data flow optimization to enhance reporting performance.
Developing and updating technical documentation.
Collaborating with IT/Digital team members to set up and maintain BI tools, infrastructure, and integration with the organization’s data sources.
Maintaining and supporting Power BI.

  What you’ll need to succeed

4+ years of related experience plus relevant training and education.
Proficiency in the use of Power BI. Those without experience with Power BI but with proven experience and aptitude with other BI tools such as Tableau and Qlik Sense may be considered.
Experience with data modelling and data schemas.
Experience with database operations and optimization for MS SQL Server.
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework.
Experience with SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and/or SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative.
Analytical mind with an aptitude for problem-solving.
A strong attention to detail and a passion for standardization.
A BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a relevant field.

 We are looking for someone who has a degree or diploma in computer technology plus considerable related data, business analysis, and project leadership experience.  The pay range for this unionized position is between $46.64 and $55.15 per hour based on a 35 hour work week. If you have what we’re looking for, and have a passion to serve people and the community, and a demonstrated commitment to supporting a healthy and safe workplace, we would like to hear from you. Please apply on-line with your resume and cover letter at https://careers.dnv.org. This position will remain open until filled.  To support the health and safety of our employees and the public we serve, the District of North Vancouver has recently introduced a Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. Compliance with this Policy is a required condition of employment.  We thank you for your interest in employment with the District of North Vancouver and advise that only those shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.

 Education : Bachelor’s degree 
  Experience : 3 years to less than 5 years

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS - 336423
Desc:
Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS
On behalf of our client, Procom is currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS.
Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS Job Duties:
Identify, execute and manage risks and issues including pragmatic mitigation plans associated with this work-package
Work closely with the Integration Project lead to drive the day-to-day activities, as well as, ensure effective communication and escalation of risks and issues within the established project governance;
Support creating an overall test strategy for various specialized clinical systems that integrate with MEDITECH EXPANSE.
Leads integration (HL7) discussions with technical teams and clinical stakeholders, with the ability to effectively communicate technical requirements to clinical stakeholders, and vice-versa communicate requirements from clinical teams to technical teams.
Coordinating and supporting teams through the design, build and test phases by preparing project documentation including design documents, work plans, and test plans/scripts.
Working with teams and vendors to prepare for and to go-live in alignment with the project schedule (deliverables may include cut-over plans, go-live plans, and operational transition plans).
Support other activities as requested from the Project Manager but not limited to the following:
Support HL7 based integrations
Workflow analysis
Downstream integration vendor mapping – requirements
Stakeholder engagement to ensure the appropriate inputs and validation including key decisions
Participate in project meetings
Weekly Status Reporting
Identify risks and issues and facilitate resolution
Ensures Decisions tracked, signed and registered
Bring expertise and knowledge around acute clinical information systems and integration
Responsible for supporting the Project Manager
Monitor the build status
Analyze current state assessment and identify gaps, design decisions and options.
Provide input and support in developing the project plan with specific scope and roadmap that will articulate if opportunities exist to incorporate BC Data Standards.
Include and provide an impact analysis of the implications of incorporating these data standards into the new solution design needs to be included, given different requirements from the vendor (MEDITECH), professional practice and clinical program areas.
Provide input into the implementation plan of the proposed strategy that aligns with the current integrated Advance Project Plan (Master Plan i.e. schedule, scope and deployment)
Collect information from all downstream clinical systems required to support the project requirements.
Ensure appropriate project documentation is organized for all requirements, design decisions, risk register, etc.
Prepare meeting materials and captures meeting minutes to support the Project Manager


Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS Job Requirements:
Minimum 5 years recent experience in Healthcare with a particular focus on IT systems and operational support
Minimum 10 years’ experience in business analysis
Must have experience with clinical information systems that are specialized for use within a clinical setting (for example: Laboratory, Pharmacy, Surgical, Health Information Management, Medical Imaging, etc.)
Must have experience with clinical workflows and processes for various clinical areas (for example: Laboratory, Pharmacy, Surgical, etc.)
Must have experience working with clinical information systems that use HL7 integration (eg. BizTalk) and DICOM
Must have experience effectively communicating HL7 technical requirements to clinical stakeholders, and vice-versa, communicate clinical requirements to technical teams.
Must have experience in supporting testing process (test strategy/plan, creating test cases, executing testing)
Experience in managing complex projects that involve several integrated systems
It is an asset if the proponent has experience or knowledge of specific FH processes, downstream clinical applications, and end-to-end clinical and system workflows
Experience integrating downstream clinical applications with Meditech (eg: Coldfeed and discrete data integration)
Demonstrated clinical stakeholder engagement experience
Proponent shall possess strong problem solving, analytical, organization, and interpersonal skills
Demonstrates strong written and verbal communication, documentation and facilitation skills
Experience with clinical device integration is an asset
PMP or CBAP certification is an asset

Please provide three (3) recent references within the last 5-8 years that demonstrate the individuals experience in Health Informatics & Clinical Solutions projects. Please include the following:
Brief description of your role on the project team
Your years of experience
Additional / supplemental skills or expertise
contact information of three (3) references per individual

Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS Assignment Length:
April 29, 2023 with possible long extensions
Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS Start Date:
April 29, 2022

Senior Business Analyst, Ehealth HICS Assignment Location:
100% Remote, PST Working hours. (All consultants must obtain proof of 2 two vaccination shots)

Title: Project Operations Analyst / PMO Analyst / PSA Analyst
Desc:
Calligo is an award-winning managed data services provider. It has a global track record in improving organizations' productivity & profitability by making their data more available, secure and safe. The right candidate will be excited to work in a dynamic & collaborative value-centric technology company.
  

 Within Calligo, the Project Management Office, is accountable to ensure the successful completion of projects against business objectives. The role ensures project execution happens with a focus on value generation, to ensure we are biasing towards action, have clear distribution of responsibilities on the project, are following the desired governance framework, providing necessary reporting and documentation to meet audit compliance standards, and providing reporting and communication to enable broader alignment and business integration.
  
 Key Responsibilities

 Help ensure Resource/Project management systems are kept up to date, with accurate information based on plans - both for pipeline projects (being setup by the Sales/Commercial team), and also ensuring that delivery teams / project leads are managing projects in accordance with defined expectations. These duties would include:
    
Ensuring pipeline projects plans are regularly reviewed and updates being made in alignment with commercial and pre-sales stakeholders
Ensuring timecards are being completed (submitted & approved) on time each week and at month end
Ensuring project status and other information needed is being regularly captured by the Project Leads
Ensuring the Executive and other Leads in the business are receiving the necessary reporting from the planning systems via the PowerBI reports, and updates to the systems and reporting are being delivered
Ensuring the system (workflows, fields etc) is continually being improved to maximize the value we receive from it, whilst reducing/removing unnecessary processes and data to create efficiency

Self-managing one’s time to maximize your personal contribution to the business, with a lens of profit-orientated PMO, including activities such as:
    
Continuous learning to increase one’s personal productivity, in terms of new tools and methods, or new business concepts or frameworks
Critically reflecting on one’s personal schedule, activities, and considering how to optimize and reduce waste via outdated or unnecessary meetings and activities
Critically reflecting on activities and initiatives, to understand how they will generate more customer value, and what the true customer need is

Collaborating with adjacent stakeholder groups to continue to seek opportunities to create value, via productivity improvements, waste reduction, new value creating initiatives, etc.
Ensuring Calligo corporate is well informed of assigned projects, by:
    
 Reporting of project status, risks/issues, dependencies etc, through defined communication channels via standardised reporting methods
 
Ensuring Calligo maintains full compliance to internal compliance for project execution standards by:
    
Holding project teams accountable to follow defined internal procedures in documentation and reporting methods
Compiling necessary reporting and information packs required for auditors

Perform other related duties as assigned, available and capable


 Skills Knowledge and Expertise

 Belief in yourself to create value and bring change
Boldness and confidence to communicate fearlessly, balanced with humility and a hunger to learn
1+ years in an IT/Technology centric organization
1+ years in an Operations/Project Management related role/responsibilities
Experience within a PMO is preferred
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire
Strong organizational skills and a meticulous attentiveness to critical details
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Teams, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, PowerBI) is essential to enable daily task execution, collaboration, and communication
Knowledge of additional PM tools is helpful, namely: Microsoft Project Online, Microsoft Project Operations (PSA), Financial Force PSA


 Benefits

 Training and development for career growth
25 Days Holiday (increasing with length of service)
RRSP
Healthcare
Life Assurance
Flexible working


   Calligo transforms data into businesses’ most lucrative asset. We combine great minds in data science, privacy, security and engineering with leading machine learning, data analytics and cloud platforms to support the operational, customer-centric and revenue-generation aspirations of some of the world's most ambitious and progressive organizations.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer, CTPS - FPR
Desc:
1) Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Engineering or a related field of study

2)Demonstrated success leading project/product delivery for large, cross functional programs

3) Demonstrated record of partnering with and influencing cross-functional teams. Experience working with engineering teams to define, scope and prioritize product requirements

Job summary
Have you ever thought about what it takes to detect and prevent fraudulent activity among hundreds of millions of eCommerce transactions across the globe? What would you do to increase trust in an online marketplace where millions of buyers and sellers transact? How would you build systems that evolve over time to proactively identify and neutralize new and growing fraud threats?

Do you enjoy working in an entrepreneurial, fast paced environment, solving complex problems and delivering innovative solutions? Do you like to innovate and simplify?

Our mission in Customer Trust and Partner Support (CTPS) is to make Amazon.com the safest place to transact online. CTPS safeguards every financial transaction across all Amazon sites, while striving to ensure that these efforts are transparent to our legitimate customers. As such, CTPS designs and builds the software systems, risk models and operational processes that minimize risk and maximize trust in Amazon.com.

As a BIE in CTPS, you will be responsible for modeling forecasting problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, machine learning, algorithmic, data mining and visualization techniques. You will need to collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to analyse forecast variances, identify opportunities to improve operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. The candidate should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and present the insights in concise and effective manner. Additionally, the candidate should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business.

You will be responsible for analyzing and identify specific instances of risk, broader risk trends and points of customer friction, developing scalable solutions for prevention. You will need to collaborate effectively with business and within CTPS and cross-functional teams to solve problems, create operational efficiencies, and deliver successfully against high organizational standards. You should be able to apply a breadth of tools, data sources, and analytical techniques to answer a wide range of high-impact business questions and proactively present new insights in concise and effective manner. In addition you will be responsible for building a robust set of operational and business metrics and will utilize metrics to determine improvement opportunities.

You should be an effective communicator capable of independently driving issues to resolution and communicating insights to non-technical and technical audiences. This is a high impact role with goals that directly impacts the bottom line of the business.

1) Master’s degree in business, engineering or a related field.

2) Experience in building customer-facing ML products
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases

3) Experience working with large data sets, databases, and cloud-based storage

4) The right person will be highly technical and analytical, possess software design and development and/or IT and networking implementation/consulting experience

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.
